text: I have been going here for 15 years. It has always been hands down the best place in town. It has been quite a while since we have been there and a special occasion brought us in. The place didn't just go downhill it took a nose dive. When you first walk in the door there is a foul odor that smells like a backed up sewer trap. We sat at the sushi bar and were met with lackluster service and slightly below mediocre sushi. It was possibly the worse sushi I have had in years. While we were eating I noticed the ledge of the sushi bar had what looked like black mold scattered on it. After years of recommending this place we will NEVER be back.
Good sushi decent price, good service. Weak on atmosphere, but good for quick hit.

Only if you don't like Sushi. My party of friends who love sushi would give it a 12 if they could. I went for the company. Not much of a menu for those not into that cuisine. However I did have the Garlic Edamame. Great taste but way overpriced for seasoned soybeans.

Was in town for just one night and looked for a well-reviewed sushi spot near where I was. Sat at the end of the sushi bar and asked the couple next to me for their favorites.  First thing I ordered was "garlic tuna sashimi" and it was incredibly good!  Then I ordered the Apple Roll which I had read many mention in reviews and it was amazing and a combo I'd never experienced in all my sushi experiences!  I then ordered the albacore sushi, which is my test of all sushi restaurants and it was perfect, so I ordered another :)  This is the best and most unique sushi experience I've had in years, ever since the famous Nozawa retired in Los Angeles. And fairly priced, too.  Excellent service and complimentary amuse bouche and sliced orange at the end.

11/4/2015 5 p.m.
Four tables eating some at the sushi bar.
I have traveled a great deal in Okinawa, and all the Islands of Japan. I have lived here for 21 years. 
With out a doubt I had the worst dinning experience in this establishment that I have had in years. 
Start with patrons, I baby screaming for the entire time. 
Mother and 3 kids 10-12 years old that thought this was Taco Bell, or Micky dees anyway scream at each other, playing tag, and climbing in and out of chairs like they were the play yard. Now we have six tables and and it is like an outdoor play yard. 
We ordered Spicy Tuna it was barely eatable very fishy. Anyone who eats sushi knows that you should not be over wheeled by the old fish flavor. Next ordered Shrimp Tempura, cucumber salad was terrible, house salad was lettuce with lousy house dressing. Shrimp was fried Panko flacks. The veg. We're fried in cold grease, and terrible tempura batter mix. 
We paid 89.00 for a terrible experience. 
This is a very fair review by someone who has travel all over the Orient and this is bad.

This is hands down the best sushi place I've been to in Vegas. And I've been to more than a few. The service is fantastic the food is AMAZING! I live on the other end of town and whenever I am in the mood for Sushi it is totally worth the drive.

Four stars n 1 month ago my for fathers introduced me to the GREATEST LITTLE SUSHI place ever. Korean n japanese owned which equals awesome. Grt prices n fresh fish. No a smelly fishy is a gooda.. my italian accent rules.

This is hands down my favorite sushi place in Las Vegas. It's about a 40 min drive from my house but totally worth it. I've attempted to find a comparable place closer to me but am always dissappointed. I've been coming here for about 5 years now. 

The best thing to order here is the Screaming O. The staff is always friendly and they have never messed an order up. The place is clean and the atmosphere is fun. This will forever be my favorite restaurant of all time.
I love the screaming o! Make sure to order a sake shot for the chefs when you order!! They are part of the experience too!!

We arrived around 4:30 to an empty dining room and only three people sitting at the sushi bar.  We told the waitress we would like a table and she tried seating us at the smallest table in the room right next the entrance of the dining room.  As I said the place was empty so I asked if we could be sat next to one of the windows.  The two women on the floor began talking back and forth to each other in Japanese for a couple minutes and seeming very perturbed we wanted to move.  I didn't see the big deal again as there was no else at any of the tables but for some reason they kind of made a big deal about it.  Another couple came in a minute after we sat down and sat at the table they wanted to with no problems. Now because the waitress seemed to know the couple she took their order first and only came to get our drink order after she chatted it up with them for a couple minutes and took their full order.  She then came to our table got only our drink order and never offered us water.  With in minutes the other couple had the first half of their order and their drinks brought to the table with our drinks coming out five minutes after.  My wife and I normally just order traditional rolls and sashimi but will order a specialty roll if its not packed with cream cheese or fried fish.  Not a single specialty roll on the menu was without one or both of the ingredients I mentioned.  I had read about the apple rolls from other reviews but was unable to find it on the menu.  I had to ask the waitress if they still served it and she showed me where it was listed on the back of the sushi order card with no description just simply a tiny line that said apple roll.  The quality of their fish was sub par.  The yellowtail was rubbery and tasted as though it was a little past it's prime and the spicy tuna roll was sixty percent tobiko and mayonnaise.  Needless to say I was unimpressed with the food asking for a box to take home the leftovers because I hate to waste food but I couldn't stomach anymore and as a chef hate to see uneaten food come back to the kitchen and go in the trash (which is where I put it once I got home as my stomach was majorly upset).  The bill arrived and was way more then it should have been; instead of being able to review the bill on an itemized receipt they had hand written out the bill and stapled the sushi order card to the back of the bill.  So I took out the staples and read the order card.  They had given me the other couples ticket which had way more then we had ordered and of course the other couple had already paid what I assume was our bill and left.  I called over another women who seemed to be the manager, showed her the ticket and explained the problem.  After another ten minutes they brought another hand written bill and a new order card stapled to it.  I don't know how they do their pricing but compared to my favorite restaurant Osaka's we got half the amount of food for what I would have paid there and I wouldn't have had to use a paper napkin and talk over a tv playing sports center.  Bottom line this place gave me a bad taste in my mouth in more ways then one.

Yummy! Fish is fresh, creative sushi and a wide variety. It's always packed which means the turnover of ingredients is often, fresh.
Try the Gail Special, Washington Roll and Apple Roll (rolled with fresh green apple (truly unique and crisp clean taste). I will go back again and again.

One of our favorite sushi places in town. The food is always great and yes sometimes they can get slammed which means you may have to wait a little longer for your sushi but I've never had a bad experience. The sushi chefs are always great and we keep coming back. Highly recommend!

My favorite sushi place! The quality of their fish is awesome and the quality and variety of the rolls as well. I come here probably too often and they even know my order when I sit down now. The rolls are more expensive that the average sushi place in town but the quality is worth the extra money. If you haven't been you need to go

I've been eating here with my family since I was 6 years old. 13 years later, we are still met with the best service and all the staff are very friendly and great to talk to especially the sushi chefs. The food is always fresh and delicious. My personal favorite sushi dish is Carrot Top. Even though we try out different sushi restaurants, we keep coming back here because to us, no other place comapres.

Food is amazing!! My wife and I had our first date here and the food is still just as amazing as it was then! Screaming O without Tuna is one of our go to's along with their Shoyu Ramen!! All of their sushi rolls are amazing including their Japanese Lasagna, Kiss of Fire and Ultimate Shrimp Roll!! Must go local sushi!!!

I have traveled to many countries and U.S states........and there is NOTHING like Sushi Fever.....So Unique, So Delicious.....Just to think about some of my favorite dishes in this place and my mouth start watering!!!! When I die; I will take one of their chef with me; to prevent not to double die :D

Bar-none this is one of my favorite sushi restaurants in Vegas. I know that some people will disagree with me on this but although they're good this is not my favorite place to go eat rolls. Yea yea i know that rolls are the big thing these days but if that's why you're going to Sushi Fever i think you might be missing out.

The produce is top quality and I'm real happy with good old fashioned nigiri or sashimi. And I think they probably have the best Scream O in Vegas. 

Customer service is always excellent, attentive and never disappoints. If you don't know, now you know.
Always good and fresh.... Just boring and not innovative enough, busy usually.... Lunch special is good! Otherwise pretty pricey for a strip mall sushi place....
My favorite sushi place in town. The employees are always very kind and helpful. Food is fresh and tasty. They always appreciate my business.

Came in for the first time with a friend of mine to celebrate international sushi day! The food was good and well portioned; the only thing I would say was the yum yum roll was lack luster in taste however, my dragon roll was perfect so it made up for it :) Just like other sushi places, their prices for their rolls were similiar, but instead of charging, they gave us free edamames :) Sadly they don't have all you can eat, but I would still consider coming back in one day and try their other rolls :)

This is the best Sushi Restaurant I've ever eaten at in my life. I no longer live in Nevada but I continue to search for flavors like I've tasted at the fever with no luck. I'll keep finding excuses to visit Vegas so I can eat my favorite sushi.... The Carrot Top, Monica, Screaming O and garlic edamame are musts!!!

I'm in Vegas on business this week and ate here three times I liked it so much. I brought a friend of mine with me today and he confirmed he liked it just as much. Good sushi, reasonable prices, great service.

AMAZING ! 

This is my families to go place for all special days . Mother's Day ,Father's Day ,Even my 6 year old requests this place for her birthday . 

Food always good one of my favorites is the Monkey Roll you gotta try it . And the green tea ice cream is yummy .

Service is always great , we always sit at the bar ,last time we went we had MJ he was is a great chef . 
Really recommend it . Fresh fish and great prices .
Love this place. Sushi chefs are very friendly and sushi is delicious. Love the Screaming O, something wrong #7,jay roll... Can't go wrong. Nico makes the best spicy tuna salad. Mmmmm.

sushi fever has been a long time favorite of mine... i haven't lived in las vegas for a few years but every time i go back the sushi chefs seem to remember me like no time has lapsed. it is a great feeling!
my personal favorite is the Dale Earnhardt roll... my mouth is salivating just writing this. i have yet to experience a sushi place quite like sushi fever... the portions are nice and large and the price is fair. i also am fond of the cucumber salad and edamame that comes with the food. this restaurant is something i highly recommend to anyone living in las vegas or even just visiting. A+

We've been coming here for years and love it!!! So many specialty rolls to choose from, fresh fish/great quality, and awesome staff. The rolls are a little pricey...but they are worth it. I've never found a better 'Screaming Orgasm' anywhere else. Love, love, love this place!!

This place is awesome! The quality of the fish is great and the rolls are so creative and delicious! I definitely go here at least once a month. The rock 'n' roll is to die for! It is reasonably priced.

Sushi Fever and I Love Sushi in Henderson are the two best (generally affordable) sushi places in Las Vegas. Reviews that rate other places higher than either of these two are either flukes or misguided and should be ignored. I go to I Love Sushi at least once a week. Simply outstanding.

Nobu at the Hard Rock is fantastic but too pricey for some.

Best sushi in town! Been coming here for years and the fish is always fresh. The sushi chefs are great and will help you pick out a roll if you are not familiar with the menu. My favorite rolls are the Something Wrong #7 and the Grand Canyon Roll.  Try the Carrot Top too! We always sit at the sushi bar. You get a warm towel to wash your hands plus a cucumber salad and some edamame to start and the service is always good.

In Vegas on vacation and wanted to try something off the strip, found this place and had a great experience. Staff really made us feel welcomed, very attentive & the food was definitely something we will come back to. Great food Great Prices!
Fresh sushi with a great assortment of rolls.  Service is on top of it.  They have large TV's for watching games. Only neg. place could work on cleanliness.

The specialty rolls set this place apart from other sushi places in Vegas.  The J-roll is what makes this a 4 star; very garlic and spicy, it is delicious!  I'm not a fan of the monkey roll, but if you like sweet sushi, it will work for you.  Everything else is on par, so I'd stick with the specialty stuff.
This is one of my favorite sushi places to go with my husband. Such amazing rolls! I love the spicy edamame! Highly recommend!

Went here yesterday, Saturday night about 9 pm. We were seated almost right away and the rest of my table had their drinks before I even made it back from washing my hands. I ordered a carafe of one of the unfiltered sakes. It was so good and served in a cute little glass and jar. 

One if my friends ordered a roll wrapped in cucumber and said it was one of the best he'd ever had. My other friend ordered the yellowtail roll and commented that it was the most flavorful yellowtail he'd ordered in quite some time. One of my girlfriends and I ordered the house salad which was yummy! I also got the chicken ried rice great tastel.  So delicious.

Sushi Fever is my husband and I's fave sushi place in Vegas. The service is fantastic and the food is even better. You absolutely must try the "Under the Sea" roll. It's not on the menu - but it is soooo yummy! If you're short on time sit at the bar and they will treat you like royalty :)

Have been coming here for over 5 years and have never had a bad experience. I love the little extras thst they offer like warm towels at the begining to clean your hands and  oranges at the end of the meal. Can get a tad more exoensive, deoen

I've eaten lots of Sushi in lots of different cities and Sushi Fever is hands down the best.  The freshness, the variety and the service are all top notch.  My husband and I frequent sushi fever at least twice a month, sometimes twice a week.  The Screaming Orgasm, the Jay Roll and the Monica are amongst our faves.

Sushi Fever never disappoints, for fresh, fail proof sushi, this is the spot!!!

It just okay. When I got there, there was nothing special for fishes.
If you're gonna have rolls and appetizer, 
It'd be fine. But If you wanna try to have special fishes that you've never had, find another place.!!
Anyway they're not professional. Just one of sushi restaurant in town. Price is decent and the taste was so so.
I love sushi fever. They have great sushi. Very fresh, would never guess we're getting fresh sushi in vegas, lol. I even enjoy the bento plates. Has a little of everything. Katsu u is good

I have been dining here for roughly 5 yrs.. i recommend sitting at the sushi bar.. the chefs are a lot of fun.. Yung is my fav. The sushi here is to die for.. order somethings wrong #7.. trust me, there's nothing wrong about it at all.  oyster shooters are also yummy, but they dont always have it.. they sell quickly.  and lastly, like i said...sit at the bar. the waitresses here arent very attentive.

Hands down my favorite sushi restaurant in Vegas! If I could give it 6 stars I would. I have yet to order off the menu. Tell Chef Lee or one of the other great sushi chef's to make you a "special", and let them surprise your taste buds. I have yet to be disappointed.
Eat lunch here once or twice a week. Reasonably priced and the fish is fresh. Wait staff very attentive. Good place to go on west side of valley.

Very very very good. Excellent service from start to finish. SIT AT THE BAR! extremely attentive and friendly.

Screaming orgasm: stunning. Crazy horse: very good. Other rolls served were creative and unusual. You can get the standard fare, but the chefs here have creative streaks and it's always wise to place yourself in the hands of those who know what they're doing. 

Highly recommended for late night less-than-sober hijinks. A perfect neighborhood sushi place when you want just a roll or two to wrap the night up.

The food was good. I had the Jackpot roll & tempura shrimp. Comes with a refreshing cucumber salad. Single rolls are priced as entree dishes, and are quite large. The menu of rolls is super long, and a bit confusing as they give you 3 different menus and there is a list on the table. None of this information is the same.  Service was good and quick.  The place does have a generic food court feel to the ambiance.
Great sushi, Mel's Roll is very good, service has always been good. It can be busy during lunch, a lot of work lunches taking place but quick service and tastes very fresh

Do you want to eat alone because your sushi arrives so late that everyone at your table is done eating??? That's what happened to me. I get to see my friend maybe twice per year so it was a big deal for us to be able to go out together. The place had only about 5 tables full and they all were already eating so it was NOT BUSY. It took a very long time for the server to come and she made something up acting like she thought we were waiting for more people to come. Then, we ordered everything at the same time and asked for some plain chicken and rice to come right away for my one year old. They did bring rice but no chicken. My friend's sushi arrived about 20 minutes later....still no chicken for my baby. 15 minutes later some plain chicken comes. ANOTHER 15 minutes later only ONE of my sushi items comes. By then, my friend is done eating and the baby is over it. So am I. I tell them it's too late and to take it back. They don't offer any discount on the check. They don't even apologize. I ask for a manager and they motion towards the man at the front table counting money. I go to him and explain and all he says is "Sorry". I ask why the service was this way and all he said was "I don't know". Of all the million places we ca go out to eat for sushi in Vegas.....I am so sorry that we were unlucky enough to come to this one.

I shit you not, the entire restaurant heard a cat in the kitchen. Everyone eating, stopped for a second to look around to see if everyone else heard what we did. Kinda weird. Didn't sound like it was being tortured, but still for health reasons, there's no reason a cat should be in the restaurant. When asking my server about the incident, she gave me 8 different excuses as to what it could be.. The best one was that the chefs like to make cat noises sometimes????? Great sushi but ehhhhhh idk about the cat situation!!

My favorite sushi restaurant in town! The staff are always very friendly. I always get the Kiss of Fire or the Linda Special. I've eaten several different sushi places but since I've tried sushi fever I've stuck with it. Their fried green tea ice cream and fried cheesecake are to die for.

This place is over rated, seems like people just go there and claim it's the best because other people say it is. The sushi is mediocre. The fish is not the freshest in Vegas, they put green onions on everything and make almost every roll spicy... Seems like they're trying to mask the (non fresh) fish flavor. 
Horrible customer service! Probably the worst in Vegas, and poor ventilation you leave smelling like fried fish! Yuck! Definitely not worth going to.

I wouldn't say I know a lot about sushi. But  Sushi Fever is on my list of top sushi restaurant off the Las Vegas strip! They are always so friendly and patient when we arrive with big groups and make things complicated! 

The sushi never has that "fishy," unsettling taste or smell, which is always a plus and screams FRESH! 

Their list of speciality rolls is extensive and appeals to everyone's taste buds and their menus appeals to everyone, even those that don't like sushi. Double thumbs up for Sushi Fevs!

Tijuana roll. Always. Service is always good and the place is nice and clean, but what really, reaaaaaaalllly matters is the sushi. I've been going to this place for a few years now, and it's hands-down my favorite. All my friends are always satisfied here too. Just writing this review makes my mouth water. Until next time!

I am terribly frustrated. After an okay early dinner, I asked for the check... It took the waitress 15 minutes to actually bring me the check even though the place was empty.. She couldn't get the machine to run my card through. Finally after several attempts she was able to do it. I was very clear to ask her if I was going to be charged twice, she re-assured me "No, the computer don't work right." Well, I WAS CHARGED TWICE!! With a printout of my bank statement and the receipt I went back.. The "manager" told me that it was not their fault, and to take it out with my bank, as after all, it was my card.... BE CAREFUL!! If you go there, check your card statements, as this place may have a "side business" charging customers twice and hoping they don't check their statements.

I've had better, so have you.

I came for lunch on a Wednesday, and walked into a busy restaurant.  I sat at the sushi bar, which feels very clustered and crowded.  The bar is high up, and right in your face so you must really look up at the chefs to order, it isn't comfortable.  

I didn't order a lot today, so this review doesn't reflect the majority of the menu, but should still be a fair picture of what to expect.

I ordered Tuna nigiri, and Mackeral nigiri, along with an Arizona roll (yellowtail, green onion, topped with yellowtail).

Tuna $4 - Nice and tender, not overly flavorful but a nice texture.

Mackeral $4 - Tasted a bit "fishier" than mackerel should and a bit tougher.  I wouldn't order it again.

Arizona Roll $9 - The yellowtail was chewy, and the green onion was too dominating.  Only after drawing this dry roll in wasabi and soy sauce did I enjoy it.  

The quality of the sushi here is very average, and with the high prices, there are way better options for sushi in the area.

Came here for the first time today and all I can say is YUM! My friend and I split the screaming O and the tunaholic, both were amazing! The fish tasted very fresh and I loved the side of cucumber they bring out before your entree. The service was good and the staff were very friendly. Would definitely come back if I'm ever craving sushi while on this side of town!
Awesome Sushi!  A Tad pricey but excellent!  My favorite is the "Todays Special Roll"  and the Rolley Rice!  Go, you will not be disappointed!

I have very limited time for lunch, and Sushi Fever came to the rescue when my hubby and I needed to grab quick, but quality lunch.  We LOVED the Carrot Top and Johnny rolls. The sushi chefs were very amicable and cool.

This place is awesome! Their seafood is fresh and service is always good. They offer MANY different rolls, so every time I go there I try a different one. So far, they have all been awesome and made to perfection!

EAT AT THE SUSHI BAR.

The table service is ok, but you miss out on this place's best feature if you're not at the bar.  (unless you're part of a large group, I guess...even then, I'd try to just take over the bar, if you can do so without being rude?)

I think I tried most of the rolls they offer, plus several custom offerings by the chefs...never once did I not slow down to savor what was going on in my mouth.  If Osaka is where I fell in love with sushi, then this place is where it became a torrid affair.

Order as much as you think you can eat, and make sure to share your sake or beer with the sushi chef...nothing is more fun than a liquored up sushi chef!  Plus, once they start pushing their custom creations on you, then you know you're knocking on the door to excellence.

(favorite chef from a couple of years back...Yeung.  If he's still there, find him, buy him a shot, and get the night started!)

Definitely one of the best places in town to get sushi. The chefs are very personable and make the rolls fast. The kiss of fire is the best roll if you enjoy spicy things. If you're not in the mood for something spicy, the Nevada roll, is simple but delicious. All the ingredients they use are clean and fresh. It's always a pleasure to come here and take saki shots. Feel free to sit anywhere at the sushi bar, you're bound to have an enjoyable meal.

When I sat down at the sushi bar I was immediately greeted by the sushi chef.  He handed me cucumber salad and edamame.  I guess it comes with the meal.
The first thing I ordered was the screaming orgasm.   It was perfectly seared tuna over a bed of rice noodles.  The presentation was very appetizing and beautiful.  The second roll I ordered was the Something Sexy #1.  One of the best rolls I've ever had!  The dipping sauce for this roll was excellent.  The tuna was a vibrant red color and tasted fresh.  
I would definitely rate this place a five star due to the wonderful quick service and the excellent food.  A very unique selection of sushi rolls.  
The only thing I could find wrong with this place was when one of the waitresses sneezed in her hands behind the sushi bar and continued to serve food without washing her hands.
The Carrot Top roll is something else! It's got fried noodles on top and a sauce that must have chipotle in adobo sauce.

This is the best sushi place in vegas! Service sucks but the food definitely makes up for it. Just halibut, something wrong #7 and sex on the beach omg my mouth is watering! Appetizers are amazing as well :)
My favorite sushi place in Vegas. Love the Sexy #2, Monica roll, Tempura roll, Grand Canyon and Popcorn Shrimp. Always good service and great food.
We lived here for years....Now we only get to eat here when we visit Vegas.  Gail Special Roll and screaming Oooo all day lomg

After 2nd visit with coworkers, who claim this is the best sushi joint in town, I'm still only mildly impressed.  The rolls cost quite a bit more than a few other neighborhood finds, and the quality is standard.  No complaints overall, but not worth my drive out of the way.  Would eat there again if in the area.

The poorly named Sushi Fever on W. Sahara has been my default sushi restaurant for years. Since 2000, I have been a regular, and I can't get enough of Joe's special roll, which is also to be had at I Love Sushi in Henderson (same chef).

Although the somewhat erratic service has in past months made a poor impression on visitors that we take to Sushi Fever, this week the service was solid. We took friends from Salzburg, Austra -- one sushi enthusiast, and one who went for the grilled shrimp -- and they were delighted, especially by the American-sized portions. While one of our friend's entreé, which included both miso soup and salad, arrived all at the same time (as opposed to miso soup first, tasty house salad with ginger dressing second, and entreé third), which made it challenging for him to manage all the delicacies set up on front of him.

My friend Sandra, who doesn't get to eat much good sushi in landlocked Austria, and my husband and I ordered our usual assortment of sushi, with Joe's special ($16) being the centerpiece. It's a large roll with deep-fried prawns and tuna and avocado on top, covered in the place's "special sauce" which is red, very liquid, and delicious (and definitely has some ginger in it). The salmon sushi, the California roll, and the spicy tuna roll were also very fresh and tasty. For dessert, we usually went  with just one scoop of green tea ice cream, which cleanses your palate and is a satisfying end to a tasty and healthy dinner. As some Austrian says: we will be back.

My family and I have been going here for YEARS! It just keeps getting better and better!! Ilove the sushi rolls, and my daughter loves the teppan side, George the chef is her favorite!!! he is awesome, and the rest of the staff is fantastic as well!!!
It honestly doesn't matter what you order from them, they quoted me 30 minutes for sushi and teriyaki chicken. Thirty minutes for chicken? You've got to be kidding me. Unacceptable.
Great counter service. Everyone was warm and attentive! I got a spicy tuna roll that was very tasty.

Ate here only out of convenience. Fish quality is just okay. I ordered my food to go bc I was waiting for my friend at the salon next door. When I got my food... Everything has deep fingertip imprints on it. And the fish fell apart off my rolls. The whole having fingerprints on my food grosses me out man.

I've mostly ordered off the Special Roll menu, but I haven't had a single bad roll. I recommend the garlic edamame; it's off the menu. They also have the best yellowtail kama and Philadelphia Roll I've ever had. The service is wonderful, and the food is consistently excellent.

The sushi here is good but the prices are a little expensive and they don't give you a lot of pieces. The service is horrible the waiters don't pay attention to you. I went my whole dinner without getting a refill on my drink no one asked me to refill it.

Delicious. Great authentic atmosphere. I always love it when I walk into a new joint and it's packed. That in itself says something. Sushi is good, overall standard pricing. Presentation needs a little work. Tried the sparkling sake - skip it , not all that good.

Nothing special really..... korean style sushi served in this restaurant, and i suppose i'm more used to the traditional japanese taste....
We had 5 slices of hamachi, 5 real thin slices of giant clam, 1 kama collar, 1 roll served with some dipping sauce composed of mayo, korean chili paste (less sweet) and green onions. Tap is around 70.
The hamachi sashimi was a thicker slice compared to other restaurant though.

From the moment my party and I arrived we were greeted and seated promptly. We ordered two sushi boats and the sushi was SO fresh and delicious! We would definitely come back here. The service was spot on and the waitresses were very helpful about with explaining the menu. We came here around 8:30pm on a Friday night and they weren't too packed which was great because we got our sushi boats within 15-20minutes. That may sound like a long time but we did order two and they have lot of sushi and sashimi on them. I would recommend this place to all my friends and will for sure come back!

This place is by far the best sushi we have ever had! It's always fresh. The restaurant is always clean. They have exceptional rolls & it's always busy, because they are awesome! We have been coming here for quite a few years, since 2011. A man named Kim use to be a waiter there, we always asked for him. He was one of the best waiters we've ever had. They hire only the best. 

We do not go anywhere else since we found this gem. Something about ally 1, Linda special, ex- girlfriend, TNT, nuclear roll, Tijuana, kiss of fire. J-roll are just some we have repeatedly enjoyed. Everything is delicious here. You can't go wrong! Besides that the service is fabulous! 
Always faithful to our sushi fever!!
Fantastic sushi experience....had the ex-wife, the Linda, sashimi salad, and it was just incredibly tasty- layered with flavors and textures- BAM!

I thought not eating at an AYCE sushi place would be a waste of money.  The sushi here is great quality for your penny! My boyfriend got their toro and it was AMAZING.  
Due to the pricing and not being an AYCE we'll only go here once in a while!

By far my most favorite sushi place in town. 

Geez, where do I start?

From having so many selections to choose from, one can come in here every day to try everything out. Most of the rolls are unique, too. I haven't been anywhere else in the world that serves most of their roll.

I love their "special" sauce. You can serve me a seaweed with special sauce and I'd still eat it. I love their hot towels they serve you before you eat. And oh, that complimentary orange slice as a dessert. LOL 

My favorite here is the Something Sexy #2. And the Screaming Orgasm! LOL

If it would be no star that's even better.
First of all I ordered kalbi , it was not cooked , I returned back. Next I got sushi, and luckily I start poking Sushi to eat small portion,
I found plastic wrap IN the Sushi.
And owner was trying to say , that because they are so busy.
So choice is yours.
I would never go back again.

we order the sushi boat and it did not disappoint, service was good. the sauce  that comes with the roll "something sexy #1"  is  really good, and i would definitely recommend getting the "ex-wife" roll  was  delicious.
Ummmmm amazing !!!! Wow still salivating and im way done with my meal. Service was great though i have to say the place was freezing i could not take off my jacket nor did anyone else around us.

This place always has the best sushi! My favorite roll is the Something Sexy #2. The service is great and rolls are prepared quickly. I haven't tried the sushi bar yet, but every time I visit the customers look like they're having a good time with the chefs. I definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a fresh assortment of rolls and a great dining atmosphere!

This has been my go to spot for YEARS always was good recently it's gone downhill and tonight I got FOOD POISONING from the gale special so the tuna was bad. I definitely won't be back anymore take this as a warning. It's not what it used to be :(

So far, this is the go to sushi spot after an evening of drinking. Service is fast and efficient, and when your buzzed and hungry, that's all that matters! The food, everything we've ever ordered, is amazing. DYNOMITE! Also delicious. One day, I'll have to go earlier and eat at the bar ; )
Love sushi fever....Monica Roll is my fave, followed by the carrot top...yum! I dont recommend the monkey roll...service always great!

Sushi Fever is a regular favorite of mine.
Rolls are great . My mom and I always sit at the sushi bar.
Very friendly service and resonably priced.

They have some of the best and most unique rolls I have ever had.  Japanese Lasagne Roll, Dale Earnhardt Roll, and many other incredible combinations.  The price is affordable and every roll I tried was different and delicious.

Sushi Fever has become my new go-to sushi spot. The dine-in experience is superior to just grabbing takeout, as the attentive service and photo-worthy presentation make these tasty rolls even better.

You can't go wrong with any of the special rolls on the back page of the menu- the #2 and the #3 in particular are good choices because they come with a large, great roll topped with a seafood salad, so it's like getting a free app with your roll. Other favorites include the Carrot Top (topped with fried, shredded carrots), the Something Sexy #2 (topped with grilled mushrooms and onions), and the Linda Special (topped with grilled peppers and onions)... in addition to tons of toppings, these rolls usually all come with their own dipping sauce. Authentic Japanese sushi this is not, but the rolls are great nonetheless. 

The best rolls here will set you back $14-17, but they're large portions (usually 8-10 pieces) and packed with fish and ingredients rather than rice. Sashimi is good here too, served with fresh lemon, radish, and shiso leaf, and cut nice and thick.

I've found the service is best when eating at the sushi bar. You get a cucumber salad and edamame upon being seated, then place your orders and get fresh orange slices to finish. Chefs are attentive about taking and pacing orders, and friendly without being intrusive. I find myself willingly spending more and ordering less by opting to eat here instead of one of the many AYCE places around town.
My wife and I are from Huntington Beach ca. And this place rocks. Great food fast service and good prices.  Highly recommend

Definitely a fan of Sushi Fever- it was a long time staple in our family's dinner plans. They have a lot of things going for them: good fish, open late, friendly service, and some really great rolls. I would suggest sitting at the sushi bar- it's a very pleasant experience between the sushi chefs and the other diners, who tend to be a friendly crowd. However, they have a split restaurant of sorts, one side with the sushi bar and tables, and the other with Teppanyaki. I generally prefer the sushi side, but I have gone with groups for Teppanyaki and it was also a good experience (consistently good food, great service, and not too loud), so if you're a big Teppanyaki fan, they do that well too!
One of the difficulties in finding sushi in Vegas is the tendency of restaurants on the strip to charge exorbitant prices for mediocre fish- Sushi Fever charges reasonable prices for good fish (and pretty good portions too!) and great service. 

Here are a few of my favorites:
-Gail special roll (spicy tuna, more tuna, and ponzu- whats not to like?)
-Screaming O
-Yellowtail sashimi with jalapeño (this one is so good, it's tough to share!)
best near Summerlin...hidden gem, locals fav.
Great spot. A friend recommended and it lived up to the hype. I will come back here for sure. Great service and sushi was delicious.
I make a point to come here every time I go to Vegas. From the complimentary cucumber salad and edamame to the delicious sushi rolls (get the 90% roll!) this place never disappoints me.

The spin-off restaurant located in Austin, TX is our local go-to sushi place.  So we decided when we came to Vegas, we needed to visit the place that started it all.

Unfortunately, we were less than blown away.  The service was slow, the fish was not as fresh as we've come to expect, and one of our rolls was not ordered or overlooked by the chef, so it was brought to the table long after we'd finished everything else.  No apologies, just a shrug from the waitress.

We couldn't wait to get back to Texas and visit our old standby, which we did last night.
Great sushi. We particularly love the "monkey roll" and "something sexy number 1". The only reason I gave this 4 stars is that the restaurant is lacking in ambience and atmosphere

Best sushi ever. The taste explodes in your mouth. So many options. You can ask for anything and they are very nice. Awesome selection of sashimi and hand rolls. The spicy tuna and crab is mouthwatering

Joe our Sushi Bar Ozeki Chef was super nice and really skilled.
Great food, Great staff, Great service, Great fun light and happy atmosphere.
This will be our new go to Sushi Bar in town.
Very, Very good.
Arigato!

One of my personal all time favorite sushi joints in Las Vegas!

I suggest the Dr Garber roll with spicy mayo! Amaaaaazing!

The sushi chef's are great to interact with as well, not boring like a lot of other places!

Food good, nothing spectacular, standard Japanese menu. Service is great. They are very friendly and make you feel welcome.
The pricing is my biggest problem with this place. We eat here every so often as its close to the house. Normally order out. We ate there tonight and I ordered a water. Rest of the group ordered misc drinks. Got the combo plate and was charged $2 more for beef. You have to read the fine print on the specials. For just my dinner and 2 cali rolls bill came to about $35 for just me without tip. I asked for a to go box and was given a teeny tiny box. Was afraid to ask for a bigger one as there might be a styrofoam charge additional so I just crammed everything in there and went on my  merry way.
Place had a nice vibe. Big tvs everywhere. Not a whole lot of seating so come early and not during prime dinner times or you will have to wait.
Pretty average food not worth the added charges. Portions were small. Other specialty sushi was good but again the prices were a high compared to other places and nothing especially great. The teriyaki beef that was an additional $2 was silly small. About 6 little pieces of meat with a splat of teriyaki sauce and not the best quality cut, kinda chewy. Have no reason to come back.

One of my favorite places in town!

The rolls are huge and I love the toppings. One roll will fill you up and I typically split two of my favorites and I'm a happy girl. The Monica roll has shrimp tempura & spicy soft shell crab, topped with tuna, avocado, spicy mayo, eel sauce & spicy ponzu. The Sexy #2 roll comes with fried onions and mushrooms on top and the Carrot Top roll has thinly fried carrot ribbons on top. Lots of fun stuff here!

This place doesn't do AYCE but like I said the rolls are massive and that makes it ok for me. Typically I'm a big AYCE fan but I can't get away from the flavors here. The restaurant itself is also really dated and the service is a hit and miss. But with all that said, I like the rolls so much that I keep coming back just for them. 

The big rolls will run you between $12-17 each and the flavors are on point. You know it's good when you let certain things slide because the food is bomb!

Sat at the sushi bar and was pleasantly greeted by the chefs. Had a couple of their famous rolls and some yellow tail sashimi. Quality was great and service was super fast even for lunch time. They were fairly busy and yet still took great care of me.  The chefs made small talk while they made my rolls so time went by quickly. Definitely my new lunch time sushi place!

This is by far the best sushi place in town. My family has been coming here for over 15 years and continue to get the same amazing service along with the freshest fish in town. They are always coming up with new rolls that are just as good if not better than the originals. I would recommend this sushi place to anyone!!!!!
The best in town!! Always fresh the fish is chilled to taste. Great service. Clean restaurant

Sushi fever is my favorite sushi resturant in town. The service is good, the food is always fresh and everything I've ordered I have thoroughly enjoyed. 

I can't remember the specific names of the rolls I order, but I have ALWAYS been satisfied!!! There's a dish called "Rollie Rice"....let me tell you, BY FAR THE BEST rice I've ever tasted!! This is a must try, trust me. Also, the ultimate shrimp roll is delicious
Always good! I ordered the apple roll, screaming orgasm, vegetable tempura, and spider roll. I haven't been there is a while.  Excellent.

The best sushi in town. I tried every sushi on the strip and off the strip and I can day this is the best of the best!!!! Ask for the owner MJ special roll and I can tell you you won't regret it. Carrot top roll is so good and salmon Holic I've been coming here for years and it's always good and always the same. Best service in town.

Definitely one of our best sushi experiences. We've eaten at a lot of sushi bars in various parts of the country, including a few here in Vegas, and Sushi Fever is definitely one of the most memorable.  All of the fish was incredibly fresh and all of the sushi well prepared. Our Itami Hoon was very welcoming, skilled and generous. The service was very attentive. I think we've found our sushi home in Vegas!

I don't eat sushi often, but when I do, this is my choice. It is ALWAYS great. Never had a bad meal. Service is great and always very friendly. They know their customers so you feel welcome. Fun environment. My favorite is Linda's Special.
Food is always fresh and fantastic hot green tea.
We set for about 15 minutes before anyone came up with us something to drink get to work on the services.  This will be my last time ever attending this restaurant

Best Sushi Place in Town 5/5

At Sushi Fever you can expect good quality fish all of the time and it's consistent because they don't mess around with happy hour specials or (AYCE) all you can eat.  For the best experience sit at the sushi bar and get to know the chefs.  My favorite things to enjoy here are: 

The Yellowtail sashimi w/ jalapeño served on a cold plate.  For a little extra spicy kick you can ask for it served with a little Sriracha sauce.

Rock & Roll: Crab, tuna, salmon, yellowtail, w/ a cucumber wrap outside sprinkled with sesame seeds and a chef's special dipping sauce. (No rice or seaweed in this one)

Kiss of Fire: Spicy crab, tempura shrimp, cucumber, soft shell crab, and albacore tuna inside.  Jalapeño on top with extra spicy ponzu sauce.

IMO they have the best cucumber salad out of any I have ever tasted anywhere. The Spicy California Roll is excellent here as well.

Uni when they have it is fresh and delicious.

Friendly employees and a clean establishment.
Sushi fever is so delicious. We away have good time to visit this place. My favorite are Linda roll and carrots top.

No AYCE menu so whatever you get will be a waste of money. The city has so many all you can eat sushi bars and frankly I'm surprised this place is even open. Mediocre sushi usually belongs on an AYCE menu but I guess people like paying full price for that dry rice.
My fav rolls are the salmon holic and something wrong #7 one of the best places in Vegas!! Pricey. Worth every dime
***Beware*** Under new management and service and food has gone down hill... very disappointing after coming here for so many years.  Will not be back anytime soon.

The freshest and best fish on the west side. Specialty rolls are amazing. If you don't see what you like, let them know and they will create something on the fly. And keep an eye out for the sushi baby!

I went here for the first time for take out . It was really good... tried Mel's Roll Cucumber, Shrimp and Crab... with EEL sauce. I'm kinda picky with sushi... but liked so much , look forward to coming back!

Let's be honest. We do AYCE for the value but when my friend wanted to celebrate her birthday at Sushi Fever, a non-AYCE restaurant, I was hesitant but I went anyway bc it WAS her birthday. 

The Monica Roll ($15) was pretty tasty with spicy soft shell crab, shrimp tempura, tuna, and spicy mayo. The letdown of this roll was the accompanied dipping sauce-white, watery & tasteless mayo-ish sauce. 

I also ordered the Jay Roll ($16) which was similar to the Monica but it had salmon, yellowtail, and jalapeño. The spicy ponzu dipping sauce was so delish that I dipped my Monica roll into this sauce. 

I also ordered the Spicy Albacore roll. (Forgot the cost.) This entree may be the only roll worth getting bc it was too unique. The roll was formed in a circle topped with ultra fine fried carrot strings that tasted like sweet potatoes. The actual roll was sweet and ponzu salty with the cold freshness of the albacore. My mouth was dancing on a Japanese cloud 9! 

I also ordered a Soft Shell Crab hand roll ($9.25) with avocado. Apparently it cost $1 more for the avocado. (The server didn't advise of the extra charge.)

In short, my first non-AYCE sushi experience may most likely be my last bc the value is better at the AYCE. I didn't feel that the fish was more, or less, fresh than the AYCE. The service was very  attentive.

I have gone here a few times back in the past when visiting my family, and so I have tried it again now that I live here. 
My 1st visit was with a friend and we have fabulous sushi. We sat at the sushi bar and it was the middle of the afternoon so the service was great. 
My 2nd time here was on a Friday night and of course it was packed. 
Now while my sushi was of course fabulous, the service SUCKED ASS, I feel I should mention the prices as well are WAY over what they should be! 
I am a sushi addict and don't mind paying good money for the sushi, but this place is just overcharging on all accounts. 
I'm good without this place, I will stick with Naka Sushi since they are wonderful and great priced!
This place is clean and fast and their food is amazing! I had the soft shell crab and the brother roll. Both amazing!! This is my new favorite sushi spot in vegas.

I am way past due on reviewing this spot since I've only been coming here for the past 3 years haha. I just want to start by saying this is my all time favorite sushi spot in town. Their fish is always fresh and their food is always on point. They also have their own sauces made in house which really sets them apart from other places. I have had quite a few of their rolls, but my favorite is the carrot top. They deep fry some carrots as a topping which is a great addition because of the flavor and texture. They put lots of sauce surrounding the roll but it never bothers me because it is delicious to dip the roll and the fried carrots in it. My mouth is watering as in writing this review lol but really though, I could eat at this place everyday because it's that damn good.

One of those Vegas classics that you can always count on. The rolls are good, and the fish is fresh. Would get a 5 but the room is a little outdated and run down. It would be great to see the space get a little face lift. 
Still, I'll definitely be back.

I came Sunday with my son about 4:15pm. I have to say that normal sushi bar staff was not there and the service and quality of food was definitely not the same. The only thing that I can say that was not much different were the 2 Japanese Lasagnes. I also ordered a James Bond and it was one of the worst stale tasting rolls I have had in years. I wanted to ask him if he had pre- made it or something. It tasted like the rolls you get from the supermarket deli section. I also ordered the FindomSarah which was not bad but not great. My son ordered another roll with salmon but it also was not up to par with the high standards I have set for this restaurant. The worst thing is although I didn't say anything at the time I was at the restaurant I have called to speak to the manager for the last 2 days and have not received a call back. I have read on other Yelp reviews that Sushi Fever is under new management which is probably the reason for such drastic change or maybe because it was a Sunday and not managed the same. I hope this was a fluke but will definitely stop coming here if no one even calls me back..
amazing! My favorite sushi place in vegas! Chefs are a blast!

The food (sushi) is always good and Young, the one of the sushi chefs, always provides good service.  We have been going there for several years now and really have not been disappointed.  Try the Dale Earnhardt Roll!!

I've been dining at this place since I accidentally discovered it with my sister, three years ago. We had no idea what to order so our server recommended the Linda Special. It was beyond good! Fresh, the rice consistency was perfect, it had a certain crunch to it and the soy sauce/ chili/ mayonnaise mixture to dip the sushi in is uniquely delicious! I introduced several of my coworker friends to this place and they loved it too! The sushi is a bit pricey, but so worth it. If you're on a budget, they have bento boxes that have a little of everything, for less than $10. Highly recommend this place!

I'm obsessed with this place, as you can probably tell by the number of checkins I have at Sushi Fever. I used to eat here almost every day when I would work out at City Athletic Club across the street. 

The waitresses/waiters are really nice. A lot of them have what I order memorized which makes things easy since I can be a bit high maintenance when it comes to ordering my sushi. My favorite item to order here, hands down is the Apple Roll. It consists of salmon, tuna and yellowtail with avocado wrapped in green apple with a dot of Sriracha on each piece. I like it because there's no rice so it is the perfect low carb option for me. They serve the Apple Roll with spicy ponzu sauce with cut up scallions in it. The sauce goes perfectly with the tart taste of the green apple. So delish and refreshing in the summer time! I crave these often and am pretty much hooked on this place as a result. Be forewarned it takes a bit longer for them to make this because of them having to cut the apple, but it is well worth the wait. I'd suggest to order a few other items so that you have something to tide you over in the meantime.

The Garlic Tuna and Ultimate Shrimp roll are also really good and both are worthy of a mention.

This is my favorite place in town for specifically just sushi rolls!! Their signature rolls they have here are as tasty and as fancy as it gets for sushi rolls!! They have a roll called the Stingman, a no rice roll that's phenomenal, and Something Sexy #1 and #2 are great as well!! Just can't go wrong, if your in the mood for some great sushi ROLLS this is the place!!

This is my Favorite sushi spot in Vegas, I have been coming here since 2009! The service is quick and the food delicious and very fresh! This is not one of those AYCE sushi joints and that's ok! The rolls are delicious and you can always ask them to create a different kind of roll for you, maybe they will name it after you! My favorites are the Bonzai roll- a tempura shrimp roll wrapped in rice paper, with various veggies and eel sauce and the Ultimate Shrimp a tempura shrimp roll topped with avid acid and spicy tuna and spicy mayo and eel sauce!

I used to go to Sushi Fever (daily) for over a year until recently. I decided to stop going after an inapropriate conflict with one chef in paticular. That issue aside, the food is good, and the service was friendly. The tuna and rolls are freshry.  I recommend their word of mouth special called, "Findom Sarah Appetizer". 

(Who knows, it's possible, once this chef was no longer there, I'd resume my usual business with Sushi Fever once again, as well as update my review.... I must add, it's a shame this deterioration happened, because I used to really enjoyed eating at SF. But the continual bad treatment just ruined the experience for me).

Sushi is pretty decent.   Kinda weird seeing owner up front with calculator counting his money.   Like go to another room greedmeister.   Couple waitresses were socially inept.    Eating and they are sticking the bill in my face to sign.  I said to set the bill down and they just stood there like the credit card company was closing down forever.

Sushi Fever indeed!!  (Note, I'd give this a 3.5 stars, but am rounding it up because of the vast selection of rolls... I'll get to that soon)

Ok, this is not the cheapest sushi place around. No AYCE, and the rolls are fairly pricey.  But the rolls... Good gosh there are a lot of choices!! I counted 75!! That's seventy-five choices of sushi rolls!! How can people ever decide??  Well, decide we had to do.

I feel as though I decided pretty well, getting the Love Me Tender and the OMG rolls.  I was kind of cheating- both had cooked items in them rather than raw, but who cares.  They were both very, very tasty, but the Love Me Tender was my favorite. Both were full of fish, not rice, and came with their own sauces, so I didn't even need to mix up the soy and wasabi.  

Now, service was the downside of Sushi Fever.  We sat at the bar, and it took a long time to get the chef's attention for our order.  A cucumber salad and edemame (sp) were brought quickly, and that's a good thing, because it took forever for our rolls to be ready.  It also took quite awhile for us to get someone to bring us the bill.  I wonder if things would have been quicker at a table?

Beware -- this Location is now under new management and REFUSES to honor gift certificates that were issued by the prior ownership.  Too bad for them as there are many other sushi restaurants in the Valley and this one has just lost my future business in addition to my suggested restaurants for visiting business associates and friends.

When we visit our kids in Las Vegas we always end up at Sushi Fever for dinner at least one night while there. The Sushi Rolls and Sashimi are always fresh.
The Monica Roll is my absolute favorite roll around. The spicy garlic edamame is a great appetizer and the unusual Carrot Top Roll is another good choice.
They always accommodate our large family and service is top notch. Very friendly and willing to meet all or our requests with a smile.
They also have a teppanyaki  grill area that is always busy but we are there for the Sushi Rolls.
Highly recommend this for lunch or especially dinner. Make reservations if you have a large Group and they will have the table waiting for you upon arrival.

Best sushi in town! Don't waste your money on all-you-can-eat, low quality sushi - go here instead. Everything is fresh and staff is very friendly. Some of the sushi is even named after regular customers. A lot of uniquely named rolls - We like the salmonholic.

updated review:
I have been going here for years and have slowly seen the downfall. Every time I come here I feel rushed by the waitresses. They seem to come over to my table and push the food closer and closer towards me as if I'm not eating fast enough. Food seems rushed and I feel bombarded when I'm paying the bill. The only reason I still come here is for the food, because the customer service is defiantly not up to my standards.

All I have to say is I live near little Tokyo in downtown Los Angeles just so I can embed my cravings of sushi with a variety of the best in the West, but I will drive 4 hours to Las Vegas just to eat here any day of the week. Hands down my top pick in the entire USA. Next time you're in sin city, leave the strip and you won't be disappointed. Try the Ultimate Shrimp roll. Gail's Special and the Shrimp Tempura.

FRESH high quality sushi...The chopsticks are GROSS balsa wood, which is so rough on the tongue... I actually would rather eat off a spoon or fork at this sushi bar.  
PLEASE IF YOU ARE READING YOUR REVIEWS ... GET BETTER CHOPSTICKS!!!!  The food is good, but Lee was the best sushi chef ever and we were told he moved to Auston Texas... Lucky Texans! 
SPICY SOFT SHELL CRAB HANDROLL - you can order it with no rice.  The new sushi chefs are doing a nice job,  especially look for Young... our choice of a Sushi Chef these days with Lee gone:(

Thee absolute BEST sushi restaurant ever. AWESOME and friendly staff who greet you by name and even remembers what you order! My husband and I love to sit at the bar and order their carrot top roll, Monica roll, and the ultimate shrimp roll. I've been coming here to eat for about 8 years now and I can't get enough. :) well done Sushi Fever
My favorite restaurant in the world. I recommend the Monica Roll and the Shrimp Yakisoba. Also the service is so good- friendliest people you will meet.

I only eat sushi that is cooked or baked so as far what I ate, it was great.  The atmosphere was nice and pricing is reasonable for sushi.  Will definitely be coming here again.  Service was on top of it too.  My glass was never empty.
This is some of the best sushi that money can buy in Las Vegas.  It isn't cheap but you will get great value.  Go early and try not to stay late!

Always amazing sushi and the BEST service! This time we tried something new...the TNT roll was amazing! Loved the shredded carrots on top! It just MADE the roll perfect! We will be ordering that one again and again! Great job chef!!!

When my husband and I first moved here, we saw this place and just laughed.  Sushi Fever?  WTF!  But some friends took us here and now it's our regular sushi joint.  

I'm not a big fan of AYCE and since this place doesn't have it, there is no pressure.  Some of the AYCE places insist you eat everything even if you hate it, which makes for a stressful dining experience (you will eat all of our crappy sushi roll, or else!).  Plus, I always end up leaving AYCE sushi feeling sick and swearing off sushi forever because my friends order too much crap and only want the fried rolls covered in cream cheese.  Maybe I need better AYCE sushi friends. 

Here, all the sushi is quality and the sushi chefs are terrific.  I'm willing to pay more for good quality sushi in a fun environment.  If you like spicy, try the Jay Roll.  The Gail Special is also really good.  I agree with Robert T, eat at the sushi bar if you can.  Much better service and more fun.  It gets a little crowded but you can make it work.

Best sushi I ate in years.
They have NO match!
Love the service, the simple design, the vibe was real cool.
Saki saki saki

By far the absolute best sushi restaurant in town. Great tasting rolls, amazing quality & service. Visited once and quickly became my all time favorite sushi spot and I can't wait to revisit. Five stars for sure!

Must be the best sushi in vegas. I always get something sexy number two. The staff is always wildly busy so don't expect the best customer service, but when you do catch them they always are polite and ask if you need anything. Where locals go for sushi.

Four words: Just for the Halibut!

I tried that dish and fell in love. This sushi place is so delicious. You get what you pay for and that is quality food. They do not have all you can eat, but it is still good. I will definitely be coming back.
Best sushi in Las Vegas hands down. Such a great variety of high quality fish. I highly recommend that you get the Lamborghini roll!! It's so good.

Have been eating here for years. Really good every time. Rolly rice is a fave. Johnny roll was a great new flavor. Dynamite was not what we expected and we did not care for it. Tea is delicious and HOT!

Many years ago, I had my very first sushi experience here. I tried a Rainbow Roll.. So, I may be a bit biased with my review but I LOVE this place! The sushi is so fresh and it is always my go to sushi place. The main complaint my friends had: there is no All You Can Eat option here. The quality and flavor of the sushi here totally makes up for it!

2nd time here, and so happy with our experience and our food each time. Hands down, the Ali roll was our favorite. Carrot Top comes in second, and the Sara roll for something unique and smokey. Our new favorite sushi joint.
This is our "go to" sushi spot. Great service, great food. Everything is always fresh. Service is very friendly and very quick. Definitely recommend

Deliciously artful sushi, excellent service (steamed towels for cleaning hands, always someone asking if you need anything else, and clearing places upon finishing), and great atmosphere and large sushi bar with friendly chefs/masters! Order the yellowtail jalapeño sashimi, screaming orgasm, and fried banana drizzled with honey.

Very sad to have to write this review, sushi fever is my favorite place to dine for sushi. I had a horrible experience tonight that I just have to share. Our server gave my mother the check that was for $23 my mother only had $20 bills so gave her $40 and asked for changed. When the server brought it back there was only $6 when she should have been returned $17.  My mother got up and told the lady at the front what had happened, she was returning her the rest of the money when the server came by and asked what was happening. My mother explained the situation again and our server disagreed and said she had only received $30 from my mother which still would have made her a $1 short in the change she returned back! The two ladies were speaking in their language and refused to give my mother back her money. My mother explained that she would not be leaving them a tip and would never be returning! I am appalled that the server stole money from my mother and refused to return it even after getting caught! For this reason I highly suggest you don't trust Sushi Fever.

Yiu really just can never ever go wrong here,  best sushi in Vegas hands down.  They will probably never be an ayce place but it's ok,  they're the best and yiu pay more for the best.  The guys behind sushi bar and friendly and fast,  the girls could work on their smiles a little...  My favourites,  Monica roll,  some things wrong,  lasagne,  screaming o (nobody makes it like they do)  there's a couple I would like to try,  carrot top and there's one with mistake in the name  can't remember whole thing.  Love this place has always been my fav!!!

Don't tell mama is my favorite specialty roll! The sashimi is always fresh and superb. I love that they will let me call in advance and pick it up and take it home.  A little sake doesn't hurt either!

Went here for lunch with my 4 yr old and we loved it! Their lunch specials are amazing- you choose 2 items ((meat items)) my son loves teriyaki chicken so I just ordered 2 of those, and it came with soup, salad, 1 egg roll, 2 gyoza, rice, & 4 pieces of California roll- all for only $8.95!!! I got the Grand Canyon Roll, which was scallops, shrimp, and mushrooms over a California roll- sooooo delicious! On top of having great food- the service was excellent. Our waitress was super sweet and my 4 yr old might have had a crush on her by the time lunch was over! LoL! Will def come again to try other rolls!

By far the best sushi restaurant around. It is a bit pricey but the rolls are unreal. The jay roll as well as the Gail special are my favorites. Doing sake bombs with the chefs is always a good time also. Every time I get back to Vegas I stop by. It's a must try.

Great food, but slow service. When they get busy, they tend to pay less attention to each table. One time me and my coworkers waited over 50 mins for our food. We ended up walking out and missing our whole lunch. Too bad

I live on the other side of town - but anytime I'm near here - Sushi Fever is definitely a good stop!

This is one of my favorite Sushi spots in Las Vegas. They aren't all you can eat...which is why I love it! The sushi is fresh! The sashimi cuts are huge! The main reason I come here - the Rolls! The rolls are huge and loaded with fish, not rice.

The Sushi Roll menu is extensive. They have so many rolls to choose from! Overwhelming! They have three menus of rolls! The rolls are fantastic!

* Only Bad part - they don't have any of the special rolls listed on the order sheet. You have to write down your order on a napkin. They should get this fixed 


The Rolls:

Some of my Favorites

* Lamborghini
* Ultimate Shrimp
* TOP
* Sushi Special #3
* Monkey Roll

Definitely a great place to go grab amazing sushi!
Best sushi in Vegas -- have been coming here since 2001.  Super-fresh fish and great rolls.

Sushi fever is my #1 sushi spot, I go here way too often. What makes sushi fever great is their special rolls that come with sauces otherwise their normal rolls are pretty average. It's a little pricy but worth it! I always order the same thing every time I go in, a Linda roll with extra green onions in the sauce. It's so good I could eat it every day of my life. One of the sushi chefs there, John, is fantastic! He's super nice and the last time I went in he even remembered how I like my sauce which made it personable plus my rolls always stay intact when he makes them.

Two words I don't like to see in the same sentence are Sushi and Fever ... that is unless I'm going to eat at Sushi Fever.  This is definitely a "locals" place and a hidden gem in Las Vegas for sushi.

I usually start off by getting a screaming orgasms.  The combination of seared tuna along with the chef's secret sauce is enough to give anyone a screaming O.  I've ordered it a dozen times and am never disappointed ... I do wish the servers would actually call it by it's full name and not the screaming O.     

As for the sushi, it really is all good.  Pick your favorite meat and rest assure you're going to get something good.  From the X-Wife to the Carrot Top you're bond to find something you like and won't be able to find anywhere else.  The crazier the name of the roll the better it tends to be!

I love me some sushi fever whenever I'm back home in Vegas.

My favorite sushi place in town (and I've eaten at a lot of sushi places). There is no AYCE and the rolls are a bit pricier, but it's well worth it. Top 2 must have rolls: 90% Roll and the Gail Special. These are the best two specialty rolls! Gail Special is great for ponzu lovers.

The restaurant is pretty steady most of the time so that's a good sign to me that their fish/product is moving on a regular basis. Service is also pretty good.

I'll be coming to this sushi place as long as I live in this town.
The sushi here is great and the staff are wonderful. From Kate to Suah to J, they make us feel like family every time we go. The menu is extensive and we have never had a bit pick. Highly recommend.

I'm a local, and heard so many great things about this place from friends & on yelp ...but it definitely didn't live up to the hype :(  The quality and authenticity just isn't there - and for an ala carte menu (no all-you-can-eat), you expect great quality.  I don't care that only one person in the entire staff is Japanese, because if you make good food, it doesn't matter, but it is distracting that everyone there is speaking in another language to each other, and then will stop and greet guests in Japanese...just kinda odd in my book?

Always solid.  Sashimi is very good.  Specialty rolls are also tops.  They need to block the door from view in the dining room as it looks really dingy and bad in there.  They can benefit from upping their game.

Really good and a regular stop for me.

First off everyone that talks about the Screaming O is right they're amazing here. Its less of a roll and more of a pile of delicious ingredients added together. Their other dishes are good too especially the gyoza (fried not steamed). I was told a while ago anything worth eating is worth frying. While it has not always rung true this is one of those times I agree wholeheartedly.  They also have a favorite dessert staple of mine mochi. I like the strawberry flavor but mango and chocolate are good too. This is an easy place to spend a few hours eating and talking for relatively cheap.

Love this place, one of the best tasting sushi places in Vegas. A regular in this restaurant. 
Totally recommending!

I had one of my best experiences here. Not because of the food. To be honest, since my father is a chef -- I have high expectations when it comes to Fine Japanese cuisine and this spot does NOT do it right. My father trained the chef who trained the owner of this store and for that reason ... My mother and I ventured here when I was craving raw fish in Las Vegas.

To be fair, getting good sashimi and such in Vegas is quite a task. This place is local to my mother's home, and due to the familiarity of how this chef was trained, we decided to take a shot.

What made this experience so great was that my beau, who is completely allergic to fish, was ready to rumble in the ring -- to make me happy. His lips puffed up as he ate but he kept a smile on his face. My mother and I were both mutually impressed. And he made me happy ... Ok this is coming off wrong. I'm not happy that he's allergic, I was happy that he cared to make me happy... Whoa whoa whoa! Back to the food story:

Alright so service, not so good. It was slow, and the waitress forgot to give me my miso soup and cucumber set. When I asked her about it, she said "Oh I didn't give you one?" Clearly, lady... clearly... So she went to get me a set. Then she noticed that we had edamame on our table... To be real, oftentimes sushi restaurants hookup a small portion for free so we were nibbling on them waiting for our dish... Well well well, when the waitres noticed our edamame, she took it away, mentioned that we didn't "order" any, and gave it to another table!!! GROSS!! Hamachi kama was the best thing, but that's usually always safe.

The sashimi was OK. Not the freshest but the best I've had in Vegas. Not saying much. Amaebi was supposed to be live, but they added way too much wasabi and it was not tasty. Lost the sweet flavor for real.  Dynamite was frozen scallops and mushroom and rice... Not up to par AT ALL.

The best thing was the tempura ice cream, though we waited for a solid 20 minutes to get it.

Came here an hour before close. Friendly folks, place was clean, smelled normal. Sat at the bar. Sushi chefs were really friendly and funny. Tiger roll was good but not the best one I've had. Fish on the nigiri sushi was the right temp and tasted clean but not that flavorful. Not much to the nigiri pieces besides fish and rice. My biggest issue was with the rice. I did not taste any vinegar or sweetness, just plain white rice. The rice was the real deal breaker to me. I may try them again some time.

I've been here several times, always seated at the sushi bar, and have had a great dinner every time. It can be loud and hectic with a lot of random things on the televisions, but that's part of the charm. The sushi chefs are great and will give you recommendations if you ask. Love that they always start you off with complimentary cucumber salad and edamame. Some of my faves are The Linda Special, Screaming O, Yellowtail Sushimi, TOP and Tunaholic.

Yum yum yum says my tummy tum tum! This place has super creative rolls that pack a powerful flavor punch. I tried several rolls on the menu and none of them disappointed, but I would have to say that my ultimate favorite was the ultimate shrimp! It had the perfect amount of crunch and was so delish! 

Some downsides: no AYCE option and the rolls are very pricey (but I didn't pay the tab so I didn't mind!)
Good price for quality rolls! Four of us ordered about 5 special rolls and they were all fresh and a delicious combination of tastes.

I travel a lot and this might be the best sushi rolls in the country.  Not might - I have had friends from all over the world who are sushi fanatics, don't expect much when I bring them and are BLOWN AWAY by the flavors.

Sure it's not the fanciest looking place.  On a busy, understaffed night things might take a little long (very rare) - but there is no better place. I've converted non-sushi eaters to sushi eaters.  A simple Ultimate Shrimp is a sure fire way to get them in the mix.  Then you can introduce the Monica Roll and expand.

My family's undecided favorite is the Monica Roll.  Your list of tasty tries follows:

Lamborghini (share this one)
Something Wrong Roll #7 (spicy kick)
Jay Roll (spicy no tempura)
Naked Salmon (no rice and delicious salmon dish)
Screaming Orgasm (tuna and radish treat)
Apple Roll (non-rice pallet cleanser)
Summerlin Special (tastier than expected)
Rock and Roll (no rice and delicious)
Kiss of Fire

Their Udon is delicious and for your non-sushi eaters they have a great xxxxxxx teriyaki and tempura combo that those that won't eat fish can enjoy.

Something for everyone and all around delicious.

If you love Albacore tuna sushi then there is no better place in Las Vegas than Sushi Fever.  I've been coming to this restaurant for years and the Albacore tuna is still first rate.  I always compare Albacore tuna sushi whereever I go to compare to Sushi Fever. So far no other sushi restaurant has come close to matching the soft, buttery texture of Sushi Fever's Albacore.

Their spider roll is my second favorite.  They don't serve the typical puny crab at Sushi Fever as I usually receive a large soft shell crab in my Spider Roll which is always crunchy and awesome.

Ignore the other reviews about the Sushi Bar being too high when you sit at it.  Never had a problem with its height and the sushi chefs are always responsive to your needs.

Sushi Fever has lots of very creative specialty rolls and for those not into sushi coming with their friends to Sushi Fever the restaurant has really good chicken dishes.

Sushi Fever has been going downhill for some time. Service is slow and staff is not particularly pleasant. I ordered the Bento lunchbox which is a ton of food for $8.95 and it was ok, 3 out of 5 stars.

This is to update my review I just went there to eat and I was very disappointed with the food and the service my first review I gave them 5 stars because they deserved it then. But now they don't even deserve one star. They took for ever to bring us our food wich it was only one roll as we seat by  the bar and we ordered one  roll at a time. When they brought it to us it tasted warm not fresh like the  other previous times. I noticed the cooks where talking and checking out girls that were entering the restaurant. It was very uncomfortable environment and very unprofessional. I will not be going back

This is our "go to" place for Sushi, we are always very happy with the service and quality of the food. The decor is a little dated but it's clean and the staff is friendly, so if you're a snob and want something more trendy- go to the strip.

I'm obsessed with sushi so naturally, I had to come to a sushi restaurant while I was in Vegas and this place had good reviews so I came to check it out with my friend and we loved it! She got the Combo Lunch Box which seems like the best deal ever. You get rice, a house salad, miso soup, an egg roll, a california roll, gyoza, as well as your choice of 2 items of your choice in the list of options on the menu. She thoroughly enjoyed it & I enjoyed my Salmon Holic roll as well. I absolutely love salmon so this was a good choice for me. It was delicious. I definitely recommend this restaurant! & even though they were super busy, our waiter was super attentive and sat us pretty quickly.

We ordered a few trays for a business luncheon. Don't expect a discount though even if you order in large quantities because there is none. The sushi was good. I loved that they had preprepared chopsticks with helper rubber bands for the inexperienced. I think I might go again solo but wouldn't get it for a larger group--too expensive.

Very friendly service, great joyful atmosphere.
 The rolls are excellent, probably the best I ever ate !
Can"t wait to come back !

By far the best sushi place in Vegas I've eaten. Friend of mine introduced me to this place, a little hole in the wall restaurant not so extravagant but cozy, they had the most fresh Uni. (See urchin) not many peoples favorite but if you know the taste of fresh Uni, you know what fresh is. I've tried Uni from many other places found that all other places either had a smell or not cold enough. Sushi fever delivers that freshness. Therefore I've tried my others such as super white sashimi that literally melts in your mouth and tiger eye roll with thinly cut lemon, apple rolls and carrot top roll. And I don't really care for rolls but this really was very good. I advise ordering apple roll first before any other. Its very refreshing like having a salad before a meal. Its a little pricey but I will definitely go back again to try others they have on the menu and non the menu. You can ask the sushi chief to make you a special and he will whip you up a surprise. Its well worth the money.
