This is definitely my fav sushi place in Las Vegas. The rolls are just amazing and the service is very good. I sit at the sushi bar and you get a cucumber salad and edamame on the house. I will keep coming back for more!

One of my friends took me to Sushi Fever on Sahara! Great discovery :)
The restaurant is not fancy but staff is very pleasant and helpful.
the restaurant is divided in 2 rooms which is weird, sushi bar area
It's was busy but somehow quiet, no music was played till we finish dinner Lol
we were 6 and ordered 2 bottles of sake (pearl momokawa), 1 bottle of plum wine and some soft drinks.
they offer you some cucumber salad as " mise en bouche ". We ordered 3 bowls of spicy endamame!
It was very yummy! smells so good too
Nagiri salmon, screaming orgasm salad (refreshing and juicy), sexy #2, philadelphia 

it was very good but felt " heavy " compare to other sushi place I usually goes to.

I certainely will come again!
Might not be all you can eat but so worth it. No more loyalty to Oyshi which has really tanked
This place has the best sushi that I have ever had. Who needs all you can eat when  the quality of each roll is out of this world. I prefer quality over quantity! My favorite roll is the carrot top!

I've been coming here for years & it's definitely based on the sushi quality. The fish is always really fresh- so are the veggies! Also, if you prefer cooked food, there's always something really good on the menu that's not raw (their teriyaki chicken or their fried rice is to die for) The only down sides to this place are that their prices are usually a tiny bit more pricey than the average sushi place. Also, they do not offer "all you can eat" but thankfully, I never order that much anyway :)

Try the screaming orgasm! Yes I said that. It is a tuna salad with AMAZING Ponzu sauce and some spicy mayo. They have another version of the same salad with no mayo. Although even better it doesn't have the privilege of such a memorable name. Wow my mouth is watering right now while writing this review. This is also the place that turned me into a sushi fanatic.

What is bad about this place??? I have been there a half dozen times and found nothing. It is just far enough off the strip (20 min), food is amazing, and service is always impeccable. The pieces of fish are large and fresh, sauces perfectly paired, and the best green tea ice cream ever. 

The atmosphere is also great which would explain why it is always busy. I have brought several friends that don't like sushi. The one who was willing to try is now a convert and the others said the hibachi and other hot entrees are superior too. It's a pretty expensive cab ride from the strip but if you are looking for a life changing sushi experience do it.

Updating my previous review of Sushi Fever I don't know what I was thinking when I clicked two stars. The smell of ammonia in the restaurant must have clouded my judgement. I would NEVER revisit this establishment again. It's a definite health hazard. 


Maybe they had a bad night, because I can't deny their 4 star status but my personal experience was terrible.

The service was good but not too fond of the food and the price.....$$$$$ Sake was pretty bomb though. I'm from Hawaii and know what's good sushi and there are a lot of good spots in Vegas with good quality fish. I just couldn't get over the price of this place.

Came with some friends from the Vegas area. Definitely a good break from the overpriced sushi/asian fusion places on the Strip. Had a smattering of different sushi and also their Spider Rolls. Tasted fresh and well put together. Enjoy it for lunch!

The sushi was a little below average. We ordered the boat in which came with sushi,sashimi, and a couple other things. The rolls weren't properly put together and the chicken and meat skewers were very dry. I was disappointed and even sick to my stomach when we left.

I got the apple roll since I had seen so many posts here about it and it was by fat one of the best rolls I've ever had.
So simple, but delicious and light. I was really happy that they served a complimentary cucumber salad and edamame also. Service wasn't amazing, but not bad either.

Incredible service and tasty dishes. They have some killer sushi here and it's truly one of my favorites in town.  I totally recommend this and you will not be disappointed by anything. Try the spicy Tuna on anything amazing sushi is what they should call this place!   Get the fever for the flavor of sushi fever....great sushi bar for singles.

Great sushi place! I have been here several times and it is always excellent.
Fantastic service, great for a larger group.

Believe it or not, I have been coming to Sushi Fever for over 10 years...it is clearly a popular locals' spot for lunch and dinner.  Over the 10 years, my expectation's concerning sushi have grown higher, while Sushi Fever has stayed the same as it has always been...A-OK.

There are plenty of seats at the bar, as well as in the dinning area.  Over the years, they expanded their dining area to keep up with their popularity...and truth be told, at Sushi Fever, I prefer to sit in the main dining area right next to the Sushi bar.

The service has always been superb.  When you walk in, all the chefs and staff welcome you with a cheerful "Irasshaimase!" My water never goes empty and the staff is continually doing their part in making sure the dishes are tasty to your liking.  They are even willing to modify their regular menu to satisfy you.  So why does Sushi Fever get only 3 stars? Inconsistency.  Sometimes it's good, other times it is simply average.

I normally...let me correct myself...I always get the "Chirachi Bowl," so I can enjoy a variety of fish in one order, with a bed of rice, no less.  On a recent visit, I ordered it, and it was delightful with added Yuzu sauce on some sashimi, and fresh fish to be found everywhere.  But on my  most recent visit, it went back to being only an average bowl.  This lack of consistencey leads  me to wonder, "what is Sushi Fever's true identity?"  

If you like to order rolls with sweet and yummy sauce, or cooked dishes, this is definitely a good option for you...but if you want to enjoy, consistent, fresh, and high quality Japanese Sushi, there are other options in town you would do much better to experience.

-2017 review #55-
The Johnny vs James show is a hoot. Rolls were delicious. Everyone was super personable at the sushi bar. Edamame and cucumber salad as free starters.
This is one of my favorite sushi restaurants in town. Besides having delicious food, their prices are also very fair and this restaurant's food is as good as any restaurant you'd find on the strip.
Liberal with the sauce, excellent fish. Service is not bad. The garlic tuna is by far the best. The Who's Your Daddy roll is so unique and delicious. Try the Ex Wife too!
Had such a great experience! Charlie's special was amazing. We will definitely be going again soon!!!

Another must eat at place everytime I'm in Vegas.  We're lucky because we always rent a car so it's easy for us to get to Sushi Fever.  Otherwise it's a bit of a trek from the Strip.  I could eat here everyday!  My favorites are the Johnny Roll, Japanese Lasagna Roll, Screaming O, Ultimate Shrimp, etc.

The Monica Roll is hands down the best sushi I've ever had. We love sushi and have had a ton of it in LA, but this is the best. The service was kind and the restaurant was clean and there was plenty of seating. Definitely coming back next time I'm in town.

Not as good quality as it used to be.  In fact, I'm quite sure the better half got some fish that didn't agree with her a few hours later.

I enjoyed the Mackerel however and the chefs at the bar get 5 stars.

May not be back for a while though.

Why eat here when there are so many better sushi places in LV.
The bad:
we walked and had not even sat down and the wait person asked if we wanted drinks.
I asked for water and said I would like to see the menu.
There were several menus with different meals and options but only one of each for a party of 4
I requested more menus and never  got them.
Asked for a house Merlot which was $4.50 on the menu. The manager came over and said we don't have that anymore and I asked what is the least expensive wine and she said $8 I was not happy about that.
Then she said that she would look and see if they have the house Merlot. She said she had the last bottle and proceeded to pour a very small glass - less than half full.
Others at the table ordered hot food. Chicken and salmon teriyaki very ordinary and the salad on the menu never came. . Chicken katsu was dry as a bone. Spicy pork dish very good but came out only when we wondered where it was and asked about it.
I ordered special #4 which I thought were 2 hand rolls for $12.  A nice hand roll came out and I asked where the other one was and they said no- just one. All at table agreed that they thought there were 2 hand rolls as described on the menu. 

I would suggest JJanga or Kona Grill instead. I really felt hustled both by the wine situation and the way the # 4 special was described. As well as the fact that the noise level was very loud and service very disjointed. It seems that they are successful and no longer feel they have to give value or service. I see no reason to go back there.

Been here a few times and I am never satisfied.  The restaurant atmosphere itself sucks, the service is not good, and the food at best the food is average.

First off the fish is not bad, it's actually pretty fresh, but the sushi is sloppy.  Sushi isn't much, raw fish and rice.  Half of what you are paying for is presentation and it is lacking.  Rolls with rice falling off and nigiri put together haphazardly.  My wife ordered some teryaki steak dish and it was grey, tough, and flavorless, I mean it SUCKED.  

For some reason I have been here 3 or 4 times and I keep forgetting like an idiot that it's not that good, last time I went was the last straw, never again.
The something wrong roll is great. Too bad it's not an all-you-can-eat, I like getting a bang for my buck.

The sushi quality is ok. It made me laugh though when the customer next to me from Southern California says this is the best sushi in Las Vegas. I've eaten a lot of sushi since I was a child. I've been to many different restaurants. The customer service here is good, but overpriced for their presentation and the way they cut the sushi. When I asked the sushi chef if they had natto, he didn't know what that was. Lol. Not to discredit the sushi chef, but he was polite, great customer service and did a good job. Just not worth the price as compared to other sushi restaurants that take a lot of pride in their craft. Go check out Sushi Hiro in Henderson. Would definitely blow this place out of the water their omakase at a better price.

I've been to Sushi Fever a couple of times and never really realized how truly good it is until I had a bad experience at another restaurant. Service here could improve, but as for the food and freshness of the sushi - I'll give it five stars. Yum.

I have sushi almost every day, and this place is a paradise! Fresh sushi and sashimi! Authentic Japanese food, including yakisoba, sushi boats, amazing shrimp tempura and good deserts!

Order #Number 1 Sushi.

They speak good English, yet most of them are Korean. They are funny and happy!

Best sushi place I'm Vegas!
The best sushi ever! We had the J Roll, TNT, Kiss of Fire, Stingman and the Ex Wife. Absolutely delicious! Very fresh and the service was great too. Very quick!

I live in Los Angeles but make a point to go to Sushi Fever whenever I make it out to Vegas. Actually its one of the first things I start to get excited about when we start to plan a Vegas trip. 

You must Must MUST try the Screaming Orgasm! 

Its not cheap sushi... but you pay for what you get. The suchi chefs do not just slap these rolls together. The Apple Roll requires the sushi chef to peel and apple into a ribbon as it becomes the wrap for the roll! The Apple Roll is amazing, but I personally wouldn't order it when the chefs are busy... it requires way too much of their time. But if you are in there when its slow... my goodness its yummy. 

Everytime I have gone Ive had amazing service. I always sit at the sushi bar and the chefs have always been extreemly nice and attentive. I would recommend this place to anyone and everyone. 

Do yourself a favor, try Sushi Fever.

Love love love this place! We've eaten at other really expensive places in town and this is by far the best sushi around! The service is fabulous and the place is always slammed! Even for take out, which we've done a couple times having a new baby in the house, you seriously can't find better. 
We're originally from California with has some great sushi and this is still one of our favorites! Nicolas is our favorite sushi chef! They always remember us when we come in and it's always a good time. 
We love to start with the rolley rice bowl and normally go for mostly sashimi! Although they do have a TON of really great rolls. I do love the apple roll! That is one of my must haves. And my husband loves the Gail special and the tunaholic. 
Seriously if you are looking for a great sushi place with fresh fish, look no further!
The best in town. We go there often and the staff knows us and they are always polite and quick with service. The sushi is the best! It is the only place I will go!

Went here over the weekend I sat at a teppanyaki table with a medium size group, There were only two of us who wanted Sushi while the rest enjoyed chicken beef and shrimp. I had the Monica roll which was delicious and a rainbow roll, albacore sushi and a cucumber and sashimi salad. All of it was delicious. The chef at the table was fantastic he did all the basic tricks, tossed cubes of broccoli at everyones face and kept s entertained the entire time. I love when you get to watch someone play with your food before you eat it, so all in all this place was pretty good.
If your in town looking for the best sushi in town hands down this is the place. I've been to just about every sushi restaurant in town and nothing has yet to compare to freshness here.

This is my favorite sushi place!  I haven't found one anywhere that can top the quality of the food for the price that we pay.  We can go crazy and have a big bill b/c there are a lot of fantastic specialty rolls, but it's always worth a trip over to get there sushi and you can get out of there full, happy, and with a small bill too.

I've had probably about half the rolls on the menu.  My favorites are the Something Sexy #1 (With ALL Salmon instead of Tuna...but I hear is great with tuna as well), Something Sexy # 2, Ultimate Shrimp, Screaming O, Japanese Burrito, Yum Yum (Scallop Cooked), Alaska Roll, Grand Canyon Roll...and they have the best plain old California Roll.  The Apple Roll is tasty if you're looking for something different, and I think this roll is alright, but a lot of my friends really like the Dale Earnhardt roll too.  Although I've eaten here a 100 or more times so I've ventured to even try half the menu...I definitely have my favorites and only try something new when I'm with a group or really in the mood for a different flavor.

This place is a great sushi place to take beginning sushi eaters, or even to take someone that LOVES sushi...everyone will leave wanting to come back.  The sashimi is excellent here too and always so fresh.  The salmon almost melts in your mouth.  My Dad is not a sushi eater and I convinced him to try a tiny bite of the salmon sashimi and he was impressed...even finished the whole piece!  

Sushi bar is a fun place to sit and eat.  The sushi chefs are SO fun and love interacting with the customers.  Buy a bottle of saki and give them a couple of shots and they will hook up your rolls too.  ;)  They serve edamame and oranges at the bar at no additional charge.  Sushi rolls come out beautifully and each roll's presentation is just amazing here.  They do such a wonderful job.

Great lunch specials and offer  too.  And also have half the restaurant for Teppanyaki.  You can order the Teppanyaki anywhere though, and if on the sushi side of the restaurant it comes on a nice hot iron plate which is awesome b/c it keeps your food warm!  Other favorites are the Beef Terryaki...reallllllly good (not a fan of the chicken terryaki...you're better getting the chicken Teppanyaki b/c they use better chicken in it) and the Shrimp Tempura (which I don't order as often b/c it's fried) is a really great treat on occasion.

My favorite sushi place!! I recommend the Lisa Lisa. Their service is impeccable, their food is fresh, and they have a huge selection. I wish they offered an all-you-can eat, but I will still always choose Sushi Fever.

Let me start by saying that this place is awesome. The service impeccable. There were 7 of us we were ordering like crazy when our waitress said i think thats enough in the nicest way possible. She was so right. We ordered rolls all awesome i cant tell what they were called but not one was bad. 
We had the tuna sushi and like butter it was i mean melted in your mouth perfection that tuna was so fresh i almost wish it was still swimming it was so good but I'm glad it wasn't and a sliver was on my plate yummmm. The spicy edamame was delicious. We were fat and happy. It was seriously fantastic i would drive from los angeles once a week to eat here. Its a local place and i got a tip from a local to go. Its about a twenty minute drive from the strip but worth driving hours to go to. And we got the bill and damn not what i thought less then $200 for all of us with beers and sake , if we had this at one of the hotels on the strip we would have been out about $500 easy.

Always great sushi, very clean and super friendly staff. The servers always know what sushi you mean when you try and describe it. These guys are also very affordable, they have ruined me for eating at any other sushi places.

Love love love this place. Been coming here for years. The Screaming Orgasm, Monica and Jay rolls are better than sex. Sunny is the cutest and sweetest waitress ever and Nikko is the sushi master. Fresh always!

Been going here for at least 15 years. Every dish is better then the one before. Fresh fish. Very clean. Staff amazing!!! Niko greatest sushi chef ever. Sonny makes you feel so special by know exactly what you want every time and June is great. I wish there were more places like this. Pretty soon they will need to expand, move over JJ health store we need more tables. Can't get enough.

For my first time in Vegas, I can't stress how lucky I was to have family in the area to show me the non-touristy spots where food is regularly priced!

Their specialty rolls are quite unique - one of which was served in a shallow spicy broth with serious flavor... Delicious! Aside from a nice menu & generous portions, the staff is very knowledgeable with suggestions, requests, etc.

Definitely a place I have to visit every time I'm in Vegas.
This our family's spot for sushi it's our favorite sushi in town! Highly recommend. Service could be better but it's not too bad but the sushi it's really good.
The salmon is so fresh it's mouthwatering. Best neighborhood sushi in town, without a doubt.

I've been to so many sushi restaurants in town, and I have a few favorites -- Sushi Fever is definitely one of them. I've been coming here for 5 years now and they've never faltered. (And I've never once gotten sick like I did at one place that shall remain nameless...)

My favorites are the Joe Special, Japanese Burrito, Garlic Tuna, Gail Special, and Spicy Yellowtail. I also love their yellowtail sashimi with jalapeno. My bro and I devour that one!

The Screaming O is a little fiesta in your mouf, but I'm not a huge fan of mayo and usually ask them to leave that out of the sauce (and any other sauce they put on my rolls).

You'll be pleasantly surprised by the bill, too. We ordered take-out tonight and it only cost $59 for 6 rolls. Yeehar!

Maybe not as good as the sushi places nearer the Strip, but the food, the price and the service don't disappoint!

And what is BEST? One does NOT have to deal the crowd and queues of tourists to Las Vegas!!! 

Oh, btw, try the "Something Sexy #2" - a delectable fusion of traditional sushi ingredients and more contemporary sauce and spices.

This establishment did not given me any reason not to give them a five, so here it is.

This place was recommended to me by someone who does not use Yelp, therefore I was a little skeptical. We tasted a total of four rolls. The spider roll, which was the simplest of the four, came with soft shell crab and imitation crab and it was simply delicious. The  other two roles we tried had a number of ingredients and we're elaborate, like a large majority of the menu (which I appreciate). The Carrot Top roll was covered in thinly shredded fried carrots which tasted ridiculously amazing and snackable. That was by far my favorite, so good. Then the special number 2 had a little kick to it; it was nice but it was no where near The Carrot Top roll. For dessert we had The Monkey roll, a deep fried banana topped with imitation crab and etc. Such a different combination that worked so well; great way to end your meal as it serves as a dessert.

 We were seated within a short amount of time and our orders took about 10 minutes to come out, which was fantastic; and on top of that they worked in an open kitchen to make the sushi. Everything we had tasted fresh, like it had just been made. Although the decor in the condition of the place was not at all bad it was nothing to write home about. But everything else more than covers that. I highly recommend Sushi Fever to anyone who even remotely likes sushi. Such a good experience.

I thought sushi was pretty awful until a friend dragged me to this place. I had no idea what I was missing! I guess sushi on the east coast doesn't compare, because every sushi place I've visited here is far superior. That being said, Sushi Fever is in a league of its own. The sushi is nothing short of decadent and the service is top notch. Try the banana roll, it will blow your mind.

This place seems to be everyone's favorite and lots of people recommend it. And it's good, but I just prefer more authentic sushi over the trendy popular American sushi. The hamachi kama and various nigiri were good. Lots of creative rolls.

Been here twice. It's American sushi for the most part, and a lot of sauce used which is a turn off. Service was unfriendly and scattered both times. The one thing I really liked was the lack of AYCE which can bring me down! Place could use a good scrub down.

My go to sushi spot. I have been coming here over 10 years and still continue to be satisfied with this spot. NOT an all you can eat location, which i like. Many different rolls to choose from, decisions decisions.

I have no idea how long Sushi Fever has been in business, but from the looks of the dated and worn interior it looks like it's been a while. The large interior is filled with teppanyaki tables, a large U-shaped sushi bar, and a dining room. The quality of the food is average with rolls like the Hawaiian ($10.50) constructed with minimal rice and decent flavors from the tuna. The Don't Tell Mama ($16) was more visually impressive, but flavors were dominated by the overall spiciness of the chili sauce. For dessert, the deep fried cheesecake was disappointing. The center still frozen and the tempura batter covering the slice was uneven with some areas too thick and chewy.

2.5 Stars

I've gone twice in one week, that does say something. Everyone was super nice & welcoming each time. The food was great, my only wish would be for the rice to be stickier. I do suggest you stick to the main menu when it comes to ordering rolls. Their specialty menu, although is good, we had a way better experience sticking to their main menu. The specialty menu has some good stuff, just a tad complicated. Again, service was great, food was good & definitely a spot for us.

Whenever I come to Las Vegas, my trip is incomplete without a stop at Sushi Fever (better yet 2 stops).  I've traveled the world and I've eaten thousands of rolls, nigiri, and other sushi creations - IMO, Sushi Fever has no rival when it comes to specialty rolls.

I start with the Mountain Roll - then the Screaming Orgasm - then the Grand Canyon roll.  This is what I get every time and it never varies because I HAVE TO order these rolls and I'm so full that I simply can't order any more so I never get a chance to try any other rolls (which I'm sure are similarly amazing).  

When I dream of good sushi, which is often, I think of Sushi fever.  If you like California style rolls, this is the place to go.
Food was great tonight. Johnny was quick and the foid was delicious. Like the Johnny Roll and the Rollie Rice. Favorite is the screaming o. Like that we can get in and out  on a Friday night.

Ordered 4 rolls. The first 2 were decent. The last 2 were terrible. We sat with our uneaten plates for about 10-15 min before anyone stopped to ask how things were. We said that we did not care for the roll and there was something that tasted very odd. We got an oh I'm sorry followed by a full price bill for the uneaten roll and a half. Awful customer service!

We were looking last night to try a new sushi spot and I'm so glad we found Sushi Fever becos we wanted a sushi joint closer to our home. Located on Rampart and Lake Mead.

The dinner begins with a cup of edamame, followed by the traditional cucumber and crab salad. Then sushi chef provides you with your tray of pickled ginger and wasabi.

The place was busy and is clean and lively. The bar area was pretty big with seatings on three sides.

Their menu includes a lot of traditional sushi and sashimi. They do not have AYCE.

My bf absolutely loved their Original sushi called Oops. It was $18 and has all seafood- shrimp is rolled with salmon and tuna roll and not using rice. He is coming back for it. I liked any sushi that uses cucumber instead of rice. The Pork Ramen Soup was flavorful as well. 

The service was on par and food came out quick.

Although a little pricey, it's definitely worth it for some good fresh gourmet sushi. I would definitely recommend this spot for a date night as opposed to a large group.
Food is decent.  Love their lunch menu.  They have good Bento box combination.

Good sushi, quick service and decent prices.  I came here for lunch.  Good price, fresh sushi lots of menu choices.  Plus I left fun without breaking the bank.  This place is a home run.  Glad I found it.  I was referred by a friend so made it ever better.  I'm going back especially when I can sample more rolls!  There was no wait not that funky sushi bar smell either.

This is where us locals go.  Keep Nobu for the wannabe highrollers, we'll take the Screaming Orgasm Roll at Sushi Fever any time.  One of the best and reasonbly priced sushi in town, especially when they have Toro in stock.  Recently had the best O-Toro there.  High quality.  Great atmosphere. Family friendly or for date night.

One of the best sushi places in Vegas. Most of their specialty rolls are anywhere between $8 - $15 but even the more expensive rolls are really delicious. If you are a shrimp lover, try the ultimate shrimp roll. It is really tasty and worth every penny. If you are looking for a good sushi spot in Vegas, this is definitely one to consider.

My favorite sushi place on the West side of town. It's laid back, excellent service, and a great menu. Every meal we have had there has been superb. The rolls are as you would expect - works of art that fill you up. Great sake selection too...

Love this place! Stopped here on my lunch break and had a great sushi feast! We ordered the carrot top, Lisa Lisa, apple roll and some garlic edamame. The carrot top was my favorite! Sweet spicy sauce, crunchy fried carrots and fresh fish. We used the sauce with all of our other rolls! The fish is fresh, the service was good and the rolls are all unique and delicious.

Definitely not a big sushi fan, however, Sushi Fever Rocked My World. The chefs were awesome, their off the menu rolls were Out of This World Amazeballs. Everything was so very fresh -- For Vegas, that is a BIG deal. It's definitely worth the drive, if you do not live in this neighborhood. Don't bringing friends who are put off by sushi -- there is pretty much nothing else on the menu -- This is a real sushi joint and you gotta try it.

And in response to Nikki B from a few comments below: WHO the heck goes to a restaurant 40 minutes before they close and then act that way? As someone who has been in hospitality for over a decade I loathe people who talk smack because they don't know how to be a respectful patron, who bust into a place After a kitchen starts closing down and find every reason to complain. Even the finest restaurant would not seat you, at least be happy about that. This place is awesome, trying coming at a reasonable hour.
Delicious rolls. The Dragon roll and baked Mountain roll were just superb! Very good place to eat. Definitely recommend!!!

Worst customer service EVER!!! They are on DoorDash and they claim they close at 11:00pm. I ordered my good at 10:20pm. I was waiting for my food for 45min. I could see then my order was cancelled on the app. I discovered that by myself, I had the problem before with an other place but the restaurant called me to let me know that they were closed before the driver arrived that is why they cancelled my order and they were very professional. At this place it was exactly the opposite. I had to call the restaurant at 11:10pm to check what happened to my food. I had a very rude lady telling me that they were closed. I told her that I ordered my food when they were still open. She said that they don't care the driver arrived at 11:05 and because they were closed since 5min they didn't give him the food. I said to her that is not my problem I did everything the right way I ordered when they were opened , she answered that is not my problem either call DoorDash. OMG not professional at all just the worst customer service  I have ever had, very impolite and rude. Never go to this place you can have the same quality food and even better with a real customer care!!! DONT RECOMMEND AT ALL!!!!

ALERT: Not a great place for folks allergic to shellfish.  There are only 1 or 2 regular menu items for sushi rolls without shellfish in them.  

Fan of the nigiri and sashimi - nice big pieces.  Will go back to try a lunch special or box, if they can sub out the California roll for something else.

We eat sushi about once a week. We've tried a lot of different sushi restaurants, a lot in California and (where we're from) and many in Las Vegas as well. All from traditional hole in the wall places to upscale, fusion and other types. 

Sushi Fever has hands down, the best rolls for our tastes! Everyone of their rolls has a sauce, either on the side or poured on top. Most of the sauces are some type of ponzu creation. My favorite is the number 7 special roll. The spicy edamame is also good. 

If you like your sushi bland, more traditional, not with sauces, you might not enjoy this place as much as us. 

The service is friendly and fast, we have found our new favorite spot in town.

Sushi Fever = YUMMY. MY BFF and I meet here every month or so for girl time. Excellent service, always crowded and great sushi. Joe's Special is "off the hook" but the noise factor can get a bit overwhelming, can't see this being the most intimate spot for a solid date night. The yellowtail sashimi is consistently amazing, Screaming O sauce was a bit too creamy (that even felt weird typing it) but all in all a well-rounded sushi spot here in town.
This is the best sushi I've had in las Vegas. Great service and great value.
I moved from Vegas and I REALLY miss this place. It has the best sushi I have ever tried ( and I have tried a lot in different cities) I want to make a trip to Vegas just to eat here one more time :D

Went there for Valentines Day what a mistake! 

We ordered some sushi rolls which took forever to get to our table,.We orderd the screaming orgasm which was drencehed in sauce, and another roll which I do not remember was also drenched in sauce, I could not even taste the fish. All I tasted was the sauce. I am a fan of suaces on sushi rolls but this was ridiculous.

The fried tofu was horrible! The sauce was so sour I could not eat it. The best thing I had was the california roll then again how can you screw that up!

This place was just a waste of time and money!

Hands down the best sushi in town. My family and I have been coming here for years and it gets better every time. I have brought so many out of town guests and business associates here and they all love it. All out of state guests always request to go back. The sushi chef's are all great and friendly. So many choices on the menu. I highly recommend.

Always need the Stingman (which is not on the menu), but tonight service was slow  and many of the rolls got to us just soaking in the special sauces, making the rice fall apart and the flavors indistinct.   The hand roll nori was chewy, as if it had been sitting a long time too.  It will be a while before we return.

Yum cabocha! (Japanese squash)

Fun place.  Decent rolls! Maybe not super authentic or inexpensive but a decent find.  My cousin has dined here an number of times and invited us here.  

We had the gail special, dale earnhardt, Mistake Roll, and the screaming orgasm!  Funny roll names and yummy. I like my food drowned in sauce, Sushi Fever delivers!

Pix and more laters...
Awesome sushi chef Jon hooked us up with customized rolls and sushi! Delicious and fun to hang out at the sushi bar. Even took a few drinks of sake with the chefs. Good times.

The food is good but I did not like the service.

It was disorganized. If it was busy..I'd understand but it wasn't.

Fresh sush. Plenty of unique rolls and willing to accommodate what ever you want. I always get the sauces on the side. They have several mayo based sauces and always offer to provide non-mayo based sauces. The service is kind. There are a few Tv's for sporting events. The prices are  on par. Dont forget to Tip both the wait staff and the Sushi prep team. A go to place for locals.
Very good sushi place in a very competitive market. Everything is fresh and service is attentive.

Love love love
Sushi fever is the bomb!!! Always fresh fish and tons of options to choose from

I always get the screaming organism which is delicious seared tuna, thinly sliced and layered over daikon radish with screaming o sauce 
My favorite roll is the don't tell mama!

We have been coming here since 2005.. it has always been delicious. I would normally give it five stars however...

we were celebrating 10 years of being together and decided to come to sushi fever .. we had been to sushi fever two months prior and noticed the same behavior. Right when we sat down and we were beginning our experience, I noticed that one of the servers stacked a big pile of dollar bills in front of us to hint at us to tip them. We believe in tipping good service but this is kind of ridiculous. Thank you captain obvious !
The servers at the bar were very pushy and kept barging into our business, "ruining the moment" so to speak. Asking us what we wanted to order and didn't let us take our time... Felt very rushed!
This was the first time tonight that I walked away really bothered with our experience. Never before have they been so irritating with trying to upsell roll after Roll and then pushing us to buy them a beer at the bar.. Am I mistaken to think that we should OFFER to purchase them a beer? Instead of being forced to buy it for them? The guy tried literally three times during our 45 minute experience. We won't be back for a while. This kind of behavior is unprofessional and Unacceptable. It does not lend itself to a relaxing, dining experience. :(

The something sexy #2  is my fav sushi roll ever. They're always so nice and helpful and have so many options.  My boyfriend doesn't like fish so he gets chicken and the amazing miso soup and loves it.

My fave. It's the first place I ever in my life tried sushi hmmmmm about 2005 when I was still in college a classmate took me and it's still delish!! I finally was on that side of town and I had to go again to make sure lol even my doctor goes here. You can just taste the freshness. And by the way they have a roll named "Monica" of course I had to get it and of course it's AMAZE-BALLS!! Check this place out if you haven't yet.

Bring your wallet and your stomach. The colors will delight you; the flavors will entrance you. Sushi isn't free, but it's fair. Bring the kids to hibachi, bring grandpa for the big tvs set to NBA, bring your stomachs. It will blow your mind!!!

Every time I come here it is always amazing. Really great service with super yummy food and sake! They are always very attentive and typically don't disturb you when you have a mouth full of sushi lol like some other restaurants!  anyway it's a definite must try if you're in the area.

Ive been coming here for 9yrs and its specifically because of the sushi quality. They have THE best screaming orgasm ive ever tasted. Its made with tuna but i ask for half salmon as well. And the "screaming orgasm" sauce is the best for dipping other rolls as well even if your not enjoying the "screaming orgasm"

No all you can eat which I think helps with the food quality staying so consistent.

Great chefs and waitresses. 

Only downfall is they dont have a full bar but still have a good selection of beer and sake.

I went right about 6pm. It was poppin! Luckily there was plenty of room for me at the sushi bar. (My favorite place to sit) I was greeted immediately, given my plate with ginger and wasabi, some edamame, and a cucumber salad. All free!!! That was such a great surprise! I ordered the sashimi 10 piece platter. The fish was all fresh and delicious. (Salmon is my favorite and it was like butter, yummy) Then I ordered a "Oops" roll. It had salmon, tuna, crab salad, shrimp, deep fried jalapeños, and spicy mayo. (I believe that was all that was in it) It was absolutely DELICIOUS!!!!! Full of flavor, and no rice! What a great option. 
The menu was spectacular! They really organized it into great categories that really made it easy to order. Usually at sushi restaurants, it take me FOREVER to decide because I have to read all of them and sift through all of them. At Sushi Fever, they organize it by tempura, rolls without rice, etc. 
The sushi chef was super nice, friendly, fast, and easy to talk to. 
I am SUPER excited to have found a GREAT sushi place! I will be coming back soon!
Update- upon seeing I left a one star review they took care of my order as they should have.

I have been here a half-dozen times for lunch and have had good experiences.  It's not an AYCE place, but the Sushi is tasty.  Most of the time, I get a lunch special which has a protein (teriyaki chicken for example), a 4 pc California roll, soup, rice, smidge of salad, etc. for a very reasonable price.  I can't eat all of the food that is served.

Service is always great and the staff is always friendly

A good place to eat.

I recently moved to Summerlin from Chino Hills in Southern California. There were quite a few good sushi restaurants back home, and I was looking forward to trying and finding some good ones out here in Las Vegas. So, after a quick scan on yelp, we decided to check out Sushi Fever.

Now, I haven't tried any sushi from anywhere else here in Las Vegas yet, but compared to places I've been previously, this was easily one of the worst. We went on a Saturday afternoon, around 1 o'clock, and the place was moderately busy. Our service was a little on the slow side, but not the worst I've experienced. Our food, however, was a very big disappointment, especially for the price. The rolls average around $14, and based on the quality and quantity they give, I'd put their value closer to $7-$8. We ordered 2 Miso Soups, 1 order of steamed Gyoza, 1 order of yellowtail nigiri, 1 kamikaze hand-roll, 1 yum yum hand-roll, 1 Mistake specialty roll, 1 Volcano specialty roll, and just water to drink. The bill was $54. I'd probably rate this place a 2 - 2.5 star establishment if the bill was closer to $30.

As for our food, the miso soup was extremely bland, with an over powering taste of onion. I'm not sure how they managed to screw up miso soup, but they did. There was a lot of tofu though, so that may or may not be a bonus for some people. The gyoza was a limp sack of spinach, with a mediocre sauce on the side. We ate half of them before deciding we'd rather be hungry than continue eating those. The yellowtail nigiri was alright, nothing special, nothing terrible. The kamikaze hand-roll was definitely on the lower end of hand-rolls I've had, and all of the cream cheese was on the bottom for some reason, so the last bite was exceptionally bad. The yum yum hand-roll also managed to have an overpowering oniony taste somehow, despite me not actually seeing any onions. The mistake specialty roll was on par with a Vons brand spicy tuna roll, except this one looking like it was rolled by someone with tremors. Finally, the volcano specialty roll. This was easily the best thing we ordered off the menu, but it came out 10 minutes after the rest of our food, cost $12, and we only got 4 medium sized pieces of sushi. Plus, it was a baked roll, despite not mentioning that on the menu, which sadly my fiancee doesn't like.

I don't know if this place just has off days or what, but we definitely won't be coming back. I've generally been pretty pleased with the restaurant scene out here, and I was pretty surprised at how bad the food was for the price. I hope the other nearby sushi bars can do better.

I really like sushi fever for their specialty rolls. They have page after page of different rolls: baked, fresh, tempura, all with tasty sauces. Their screaming orgasm sauce is the best in town. The Something Wrong #7, Gale Special, Japanese Lasagna, and the Tempura roll are a few of my favorites. I definitely crave Sushi Fever sometimes and I've been going there for 16 years!

Decided to go here after reading the other reviews. My wife and I both ordered the hibachi steak. The steak tasked like it was just boiled. It was not seared and had zero flavor. We had to ask for teriyaki sauce. The wife didn't even eat her's. The server even tried to make an excuse when we asked to have it removed from our bill. I eat most of mine after receiving the sauce. The sushi we ordered was ok at best. Nothing special. We have had better at other places. But we like to try new places. We will not be visiting this one again
This place is the best and most creative sushi I have ever eaten.  It is worth the trip off of the strip.  A MUST DO if you are in Vegas!

The only thing that can make this better is if they offered AYCE. Otherwise it's great. I've ordered different rolls each time but tempura seems to be their specialty Ultimate Shrimp roll is where it's at. It can be a bit pricey (I generally spend no less than $30/meal for myself) but they give more than your standard 6 pieces. So I usually get to bring like half home.
I crave the Monica roll. That's how good it is. The sushi chefs are very friendly. Good service here, but they get really busy on the weekend!

For those who love Seaweed salad, and a creeative sushi menu, this place is for you!!!!!!!!
Been here many times, and always consistent in service and foods.
Amazing!!  The fish is so fresh and the sushi chefs will make anything custom. I will definitely come back.

I'd been to Sushi Fever many times in the past but had stopped for the last couple of years. Yesterday I had a meeting on that side of town and my friend Octavio P. and I decided to go to Sushi Fever for lunch. He has been here many times for lunch and had raved about their bento box. 

First off, it is 8.95, so already that's a good thing. You get to choose from two proteins, I chose fish tempura and yakitori and it also comes with miso soup, a spring roll, a California roll, gyoza, rice and salad. Wow, was I super impressed. Everything tasted great and the portions were decent as well. For that price you would expect lesser quality so I was stunned at how good everything was. Too bad it's on the other side of town otherwise I would be in here every week.

One of our favorite sushi restaurants! Great food and super friendly service. 
Service: My boys (12 and 5) both love coming to Sushi Fever because they feel like VIPs. The waitresses remember what they get and always ask if the want their usual. One of the best sushi restaurants to go with kids.
Food: don't even know where to start. Love it! Some of our favorites are screaming O, Lamborghini roll, and don't tell mama!
Will recommend to anyone!

Growing up in Florida I've developed a rule to not eat seafood in a landlocked area.  A friend convinced me to break my rule and just give it a try last summer.  I've been been hooked ever since!  

The rolls are just as creative as the names.  Have you ever had a roll wrapped in thinly sliced apple?  Or how about tempura shrimp with banana?  Exactly!  Forget your rules.  Maybe it's time to plan another road trip?

This has already been said a million times, they do not have all you can eat sushi. That fact does not bother me because the quality is amazing. I love their unique and tasty rolls. One of my favorite sushi restaurants in Las Vegas.
My favorite a-la-cart sushi restaurant. The "carrot top roll" is one of the best rolls in Vegas. It is pricey, but the quality of the fish warrants the cost.
Our favorite weekend dinner spot! Sashimi is very fresh and the chefs are so great! We get treated like family here love this place.
The most amazing Sushi Place ever.... Never disappoints!!! Linda Special and Carrot Top

This is seriously the best sushi I have ever had. We ordered the special rolls, unique to this restaurant  - nothing I've seen on any other menu. Get adventurous and try something new, you can't go wrong. The layers of flavor and texture, the dipping sauces that come with each roll - extraordinary. I will return each time I visit Vegas. As my sister said, "you will be forever ruined when it comes to sushi!"

What a delicious place! The lunch specials are great- lots of food for a small price. I recommend the Monica Roll, Something Wrong #7 and the Up & Down Seaweed salad. They are always attentive and remember what we order. We are regulars. Mmm mmm good.

This is one of my favorite sushi places. Today we ordered the special, Golden Knight roll. It was not only beautiful it was delicious! It was covered with gold shavings. You need to check this place out and definitely try this roll.
This is one of my favorite restaurants in town because their food is amazing especially their Charlie Special and their prices are very affordable too

It's OKAY here. 
Sushi Fever what a great name, so great I made a list of Sushi joints in Vegas you should try out. I actually insist you take a look at that list because I've had so much better and so can YOU.

Teppan: 3/5 I love Teppan its just something as a family or a group of friends have to try. Basically Teppan is a style of Japanese cooking where the chef cooks in front of you and does cool tricks as you enjoy your dinner. Dinner and a show what a great combo. I love Teppan but the food is only good as its entertainer. When I went I had a horrible chef that wasn't interactive at all. He wasn't even social, maybe there was a language barrier I don't know but honestly what ever this chef was doing I could've done same thing. All he did was stand there and cook. 

Nigiri: 3/5 I was happy to find a place that actually had fresh fish but the portions were off. I find this a lot in Las Vegas. The ratio of Rice to Fish is so off. This place isn't even AYCE (all you can eat) so they shouldn't have a reason to cheat people off on their nigiri's 

Sashimi: 3/5 I was happy to see shashimi on the menu, you don't see to many of that around Las Vegas. Like I said the Fish here was fresh but the slices are super thin.

Price: 3/5 This place can be a bit pricy, there's no AYCE and the teppan for JUST the combination's it was about $20-40 (enough for 1-2 people). So you'll end up ordering multiple combinations and sides. The bill adds up.

Located on W Sahara, you can see it from the street. Several spots to park, I've never had a problem there. 

Typical sushi bar set up with seats at the bar as well as tables and booths. My friends and I always sit at the sushi bar to watch the chefs in action. 

My fave roll is the apple roll. A must try. Spicy tuna is great. Edamame yummy. The scallop roll - to die for! So good. 

Very attentive waiters. 

This place is perfect for date night or dinner with friends.

Sushi Fever is located outside one of our offices. This was the second time I've eaten here. Their sushi is great. It's not an AYCE establishment. They focus on quality cuts and this is evident on the fact they carry Blue Fin Tuna. It's MP so expect at least $10 for some nigiri. I was get the sashimi here. They will give you nice cuts of fresh fish. Tuna, Salmon, YellowTail, Squid, Mackerel, and one more I forgot about. 

So you might be wondering? Why only 3 stars? This is an easy 4 star restaurant in terms of food quality. BUT THEIR SERVICE LAST TIME WAS TERRIBLE! They literally forgot I was there. I wanted to get more food after enjoying my first plate of sashimi. It was at least 25 minutes before a waiter who wasn't mine noticed me. It was another 30 minutes before I was able to get my check. I'm fairly convinced I could've walked out without paying and no one would've noticed.

A few weeks ago I went to the popular Sushi Fever on Buffalo and Sahara, where I have dined many times before. We had to wait ten minutes for a table, which may be a sign that the economy is coming back, or a sign they need more tables. One thing I love about Vegas is that you rarely need to make reservations, however, Sushi Fever has been around for awhile and has a large following. Though not the absolute best sushi place I have been (that Frugal Foodie award would go to the ridiculously un-frugal Sushi Sasabune in Los Angeles), the rolls are fresh, creative, and well-executed. Most are in the $12-$15 range but there are some relative bargains such as the Washington Roll for $9.50. This roll is stuffed with salmon, avocado, cucumber and one of my personal favorite fillings, yamagobo, which is a pickled Japanese root vegetable similar to a carrot in the shape of a stringbean. It adds great texture to the roll as it has a hearty crunch. The Washington Roll is topped with a very thin layer of salmon, which normally I would say is a cheap way for a restaurant to advertise more fish, but in this case worked very well since there were also big chunks of salmon inside. I think the roll might have been too big and salmon-y had the slice been thicker. 

We also ordered two of my personal favorites, the 90% Roll and the Rock and Roll. Both of these are quite the mouthful but incredibly tasty, not least because they both come with an out-of this world tangy dipping sauce. The ingredients I can identify in the sauce are rice wine vinegar, sesame oil, scallions, tiny fish roe, and kewpie mayonaise, a Japanese mayonaise that in my opinion is much better than American mayonaises (see the ingredient shopping page). My dad had the brilliant idea of using a spoon to ladel the sauce on top because otherwise it is very easy to lose your roll to the bottom of the bowl while dipping. The 90% Roll has fried sof-shell crap in the interior, is wrapped with ahi tuna, and then is topped with chopped and baked scallops. It's not the healthiest but a must try. The Rock and Roll is much lighter but equally delicious. It has hamachi, salmon, tuna, and crab and is wrapped skillfully in cucumber. We also had to order the hamachi sashimi, because although rolls are fun to eat, they are definitely not authentic. A great piece of butttery fish with a little soy sauce and wasabi is beautiful in its simplicity and truly lets you enjoy the flavor of the fish. 

The meal was highly enjoyable, but the service and ambiance ceratinly left something to be desired. Once we were able to locate our waiter the rolls came out quickly, but I don't think I'll be going to Sushi Fever on a Friday night anytime soon. For good reason is it a popular spot, and as long as you go at the right time, it should prove to be a fullfilling experience!
Walking distance from my office so it is really convenient, order is always correct, and the bento box lunch is always amazing!
Been a few times. Amazing sushi. ;) Sushi Bar and restaurant. From Denver. Wish they had specials. Came for lunch. At least sake or drinks.

I have been to Sushi Fever at least a half dozen times or more. Most of the time it is because my kids want to come for their specialty rolls. I think that is why a lot of people come here.
Their sushi and sashimi is good, but definitely not some of the best in town.
There are so many good sushi places in Las Vegas that this is not even in my top 10.
I will say though,  that tonight I had the live scallop, and it was really really good!
The yellowtail jalepeno was just so-so, and the sashimi platter was good, not great.
I will say that every time I have been here the service was exceptional, they are quick to serve you and quick to clear away empty plates. The sushi bar is always a lot of fun too, very active and we always meet people who are anxious to chit chat about what their favorite dish may be.
They don't do AYCE :( but prices are reasonable otherwise..since we pretty much ONLY do all you can eat, we won't be back. Picked up a few rolls to go and quality was okay, not the best.

Most flavorful sushi I've had in Vegas. Talk about quality and quantity of what you get for the price. This is the place to go! I first started ordering to-go and pressed my luck with the Ex-wife roll (ended up being my go-to a few times. I finally ended up eating at the bar and service is great! The sushi chefs if sitting at the bar are funny/quite talkative. The servers are attentive. Wet towel for you, cucumber dish and edamame to snack on while you order. I told them what I liked and they custom made a roll for me. Also, ordered Carrot Top and the carrots on are the perfect taste and touch to the dish! The Screaming Orgasm is great if you're looking to cut carbs from rice out. They even have pure veggie options instead of rice wraps. I feel like every dish alone is a perfect amount and filling, but the taste always has me ordering more!

The only sushi place we go to!
Very friendly from the moment you walk in the door. The price range is anywhere from $$-$$$ depending on what you order.  We both ordered the crunchy roll  &  We tried mochi ice cream for the first time tonight, and it was amazing. The bar space isn't big, so everyone is on top of each other, but the atmosphere is warming so no one even notices. If that bothers you, I would suggest a table.
We loved this placed!  It was recommended by several friends. Service was fast and friendly. Food was amazing. The variety on their menu is impressive. We will definitely be back!

WOW! I have one favorite roll here! Forgot the name, it is on their new menu. Something Sexy #2. Shrimp tempura wrapped in rice rolled in rice pager with tuna on the side and a garlic poached shrimp on top. YUMMY!

With so many places to grab sushi in Vegas it's hard to pick a favorite, but this definitely has to be one of my top three spots. When you walk in you can chose to sit at a table or the sushi bar and they also have hibachi grills. My boo and I picked the sushi bar since we just were grabbing a couple rolls.

Once seated our waitress immediately took our drink order and brought our complimentary cucumber salad. The salad was lightly dressed with a refreshing taste. We then placed our order for a regular spicy tuna roll and jackpot roll and were given some complimentary edamame. It was very fresh and delicious. Just when we thought we were already in love with this place our rolls came out. The spicy tuna was on point. It was not too spicy and came with a little side of sriracha. The jackpot was definitely my favorite though. I couldn't get enough of the ponzo it was plated on and the shrimp and avocado were spot on. Even after our meal we were offered oranges for dessert, above and beyond service! 

This place honestly kills it on service and food. I'm so happy to find a new spot so close to my neighborhood.

This is our go-to spot for sushi . Great fresh sushi with tasty sauces and combinations. Prices are what you would expect for great sushi but worth it. They have an endless delicious menu and the staff has so much fun engaging with the customers.

Meh.
Went for lunch with my daughter. It was super busy and felt cramped, but the service was great.
My daughter ordered the lunch time special with chicken teriyaki. Super generous portions with California rolls, a salad, potstickers, an egg roll, and miso soup. I was jealous....and a little disappointed that there wasn't a real sushi option for the lunch special. I wound up getting a screaming O salad and a miso soup. The screaming O was, well, amazing (that's what she said). My kiddo and i were both put off by the soup. It had an odd dish soap taste and the tofu texture was weird.
Overall, kind of pricey for a ten year old and mom lunch. I do wish there were more sushi lunch options. I'm talking a mean game about not being impressed, when odds are I will be heading back for more screaming O before the week is over.

My wife will literally punch a baby seal in the face for a Lisa Lisa roll.  I think the roll is great, but she loves it.  All things aside, this place isn't AYCE.  But the rolls are reasonably priced, so you probably won't break much more than you would at the AYCE places anyways.  

As far as the crowd goes, avoid Friday nights if you're looking for a quick meal or if you have a large party.  Sometimes the wait can be 30+ minutes.  It's not that the staff is bad at cleaning and clearing.  It's just that the place gets cracking!
Hands down, the best sushi ever. Also very reasonable. Take the hike away from the strip to go here. Totally worth it.

Never miss a meal when visiting Las Vegas. I crave the "screaming orgasm" and rolly rice!!!  Nice location just off Sahara but a bit of a drive from the strip if that's where you're coming from. The bar is expansive but table seating is fine. Service is also top notch.

This place is the best sushi place in town hands down!! I've been coming here for over 14 years now and have never had better rolls! The Monica Roll was made by Young after asking my daughter what her favorite flavor are when she craves sushi.  And bamm this amazing flavorful roll was born as a birthday gift to her. She turned 15 that day and now she's 23 and Sushi Fever has had huge success from that mouth watering slice of heaven!
I've had Sushi almost every where, & in the US this place has the most amazing, freshest by far Sushi I have ever eaten!!

OK, I'm going with 3 stars just because service is of the utmost import to me. The service was super inattentive despite the fact that there were myriad servers on the floor at all times. 

An empty sake cup is the ULTIMATE sushi dining foul! Grr!

This place has been given rave reviews from all of my friends, so I had to try it for myself.

It's VERY American meaning large portions and  lots of American ingredients. 

They did have this incredible roll called the Something Wrong #35. Oh, there was something oh-so right about this something wrong. The tempura yams and carrots we very unique, and this was my hands down favorite. 

I fell in love with "japanese lasagna" at Osaka, but Sushi Fever's version didn't give the dish its due.  The cool thing about this restaurant is the clever naming of the rolls (really?! Dale Earnheart --whoever that is with THAT spelling) has his own roll? Oh, and I think I'll try this one "Just for the Halibut." 

Punny. Corny. Still Fun.

But I digress...

This place was jumping for an early Sunday evening. The people didn't stop waltzing through the doors in their khaki shorts, t-shirts, and hiking shoes (c'mon people! Dress up for a change!). The fact that each customer was greeted with some foreign Japanese phrase (it probably means a$$hole for all I know because I stopped speaking Japanese in elementary school) was a unique  personal touch.

Next time I'll sit at the bar. At least I'll be entertained by the sushi chef while I wait for my sake cup to be refilled.

Give it a shot!
~L2

My wife and I enjoy sushi at least once a week and this spot is one of our favorites, if not the favorite.
It's more expensive than others but the food is always quality, the consistency is top-notch, and the service is impeccable.
What else can you ask for?

By far my favorite sushi place. I eat there pretty often  and always get the sexy #2.  Have not once been disappointed with the food or the prices. I love sitting at the bar because you get a complimentary cucumber and crab salad and edamame!! Service is always excellent. I couldn't give it the 5th star just because I wish they were open later

This sushi place is as good as it gets. I think that Sushi Fever may have actually ruined me for all other sushi places here in Vegas.

Our favorites include:

Ultimate Shrimp
Soft Shell Crab Salad
Something Sexy #2
There's Something About Ally
The Screaming Orgasam (my ultimate fav)
Something Wrong #7 - no rice
Rolley Rice w/a side of Spicy Ponzu Sauce

The rolls here are creative. The sauces are delicious. The service is prompt and continually attentive. I have never had a bad experience here, and we eat here ALOT.

The just launched a new special menu- and quite a few of our new favorites are from the menu. It's brilliant!

Sushi Fever is my favorite mid-priced Sushi joint in Vegas.  The fish is always fresh, and they have a wide range of creative, signature rolls.  My personal favorites are the Mexican roll and the Dale Earnhardt roll.  Not quite sure why they equated Dale Earnhardt with soft shell crab, but it works.  

It's a bit pricier than other sushi places around town, but it's less than what you'll find on the strip or in off-strip casinos, and the freshness and creativity are worth a few extra bucks.

Sushi Fever simply has the best sushi rolls around!  Joe's Special and Carrot Top are among my favorites. When I bring guests that won't eat sushi, the steak hibachi and chicken katsu are also outstanding!  Every time I try a different sushi place when I'm away from Vegas, I become disappointed because its never as good as Sushi Fever.  The only reason it gets 4 stars instead of five is that it is often overcrowded during lunch and dinner.  There is never much of a wait to get a seat, but you may wait a while to get your food if you come during peak times.  This is my favorite place for lunch several times each month!

I'll just start off and say that I've had much better sushi. I got this place recommended from a work associate who recommended it and she just raved about it. 
Don't get me wrong.... I isn't bad sushi, for being in the middle of a desert. But like Vegas itself, it is a lot of hype and just average experience. The place was packed, so I know the food must be above average, but if this place was in California, it wouldn't last. The restaurant is great out in Nevada because Nevada sucks and the people here don't really know what "good food at a good price is." The sushi wasn't all that fresh and most of the rolls showed the paper on the outside! Really.... name a good sushi place that shows the paper on the outside of its rolls? To compensate for the lack of fresh fish, each roll was doused in sauces and BS... Not for me I guess, but good for the Desert Dwellers out her that don't know any better....
The free soy beans, hot towel and cucumber were nice to start the meal, but the rolls were waaaaaaay over priced. Even for a place 7 miles west of the Strip. The  Carrot Top roll was pretty good, but nothing I'd brag about to anyone... The Sexy Girl #2 was god awful.... bad roll covered in fried onion, garlic and mushrooms. Just terrible.... I wouldn't feed it to my dog.
Overall.... my search for good sushi in Vegas continues.... I won't go back to Fever.

If ur in the mood for fresh flavorful sushi.  This is the spot! I had the screaming orgasm and apple roll both were mouth watering good! The only reason I'm not giving them 5 stars is bc it wasn't busy & the server didn't come around to check on my drink so I had to ask sushi chef to call server so I can get refill... other than that I would go back.

We were visiting Vegas and a friend's aunt (who lives in Vegas) recommended this sushi place. I ordered a deep fried CA roll and the fried rice. My friend ordered a deep fried CA roll with cream cheese and the fried rice and my other friend ordered a regular CA roll with miso soup.

It was okay, but I've definitely have had better. I don't like when places use fake crab because they usually use way too much. That's what happened this time. The fried rice was good because they did it off of the teppenyaki tables, which is my favorite. 

The service was good, the prices were average. Though there are a lot of sushi places in Vegas, we'll probably try another sushi place next time.

Wow! The food is awesome! I recently moved back to the west side of town from Henderson and needed to find a awesome sushi place that stacked up against I LOVE SUSHI and this is it! This place is great! I got 2 rolls to go and garlic edamame and was very pleased with it the price! I will definitely be going back here again! I got the I love Jane and sushi fever 2! So yummy!!!

Took my family to dinner here early this evening. The rolls were all very authentic  and tasty. Very fresh fish and tasty saki. The service was average, and the waitresses didn't speak the best English. I got the tapper chicken and steak combo for my main course. I give it about an 8 out of 10. The atmosphere in this restaurant is average at best, but if your  looking for good food only in a casual environment this is your place.

I've been going to this spot for years now...ALL of their rolls are delicious, although a little pricey, it's definitely worth it for some good gourmet sushi. I would definitely recommend this spot for a date night rather than a large group of people, but definitely an awesome spot!

Best sushi restaurant in Las Vegas!  I wish it was closer to our house but ever since we started using postmates we've been ordering from them all the time!  The food is so fresh and the flavored they put together are really amazing.   The ex-wife roll is so good my wife and I often fight over the last piece. It's a good problem!

Best tasting Sushi I've had in Las Vegas and I've eaten at many of them!  Not the party atmosphere that a lot of sushi joints are going for and I kind of like that when I want a nice evening with my gal.  Their Carrot Top roll is on my top 5 of all foods, not just sushi.  Their Austin Special is almost as good and a great alternate when I want something a little different.  My gal loves their spicy tuna and that thing is made in like 30 seconds when she walks through the door.  Love this place and the sushi chefs expecially.  I will say that if you have A LARGE PARTY YOU ABSOLUTELY NEED TO CALL AHEAD!

I am big fan of 'I Love Sushi' in Henderson, but this place comes close second out of all local sushi places. Whenever I don't want to drive to Henderson I always try to come her. There is a lot of choices and if you sit at the bar and explain to the chef what you want, he will make it for you, even if its not on the menu.

Quick and friendly staff, the food is fresh and yummy . We've tried alot of the menu and have never been disappointed!  Rainbow roll is of course my favorite. . We had two kids under the age of 5 who aren't great with sitting still ( duh ) and they were very patient with them! I would definitely  recommend  if your on this side of town! Check them out

This place is great. Been coming here for years, very consistent. Service could be better but the food more than makes up for any short coming in that department. 
   Plenty of cooked rolls and other 'non raw' stuff for those that won't eat sushi. Try the dale earnheart and the just for the halibut. 
   You might need reservations during peak dinner hours.

The food is so yummy and fresh and very presentable. So much different sushis to try.. It's funny though because I rely on other peoples pictures to determine what I want to try so I can I eat with my eyes I guess as does everybody else so keep posting LOL!

Teriyaki chicken was good white meat. The cucumber salad was also good. One of the best parts of the meal.  The spicy tuna rolls were good but not amazing. The cucumber snd tuna rolls were good too. The service was slow. Nice hours, open late.
It's amazing. The "Tuna Holic" roll is probably the BEST roll in the history of rolls. Amazing service and fantastic experience!!

The food was superb and the service was exceptional. This clean, little restaurant has an abundance of culture. The ambiance was beautiful and the environment was organized and well maintained. I ordered the Ultimate Shrimp Roll and my boyfriend had the lunch box special. Both meals were beyond delicious and very fulfilling. I will definitely be returning; as a matter of fact, this will be my go to spot for sushi!

Came here on a double date with Soralala and Brian.. This is their fav sushi spot.. I had actually never heard of Sushi Fever prior to them mentioning it. As soon as you walk in there is a sign that says "No AYCE sushi" lol I guess they get asked that question a lot? The place was a lot busier than I thought it would be so that was a good sign! 
We ordered some rolls, a bento box and some hot sake.. The rolls range from $8-$17 so be careful, they add up!

-Apple Roll: fresh fish wrapped in Apple and served with spicy ponzu sauce... Wow I had never seen that done anywhere else so I thought that was pretty cool! It's tart green apple so the flavors went well with each other and it's rice less... Loved it!
-Salmon lover: salmon wrapped in cucumber also rice less! YUM
-Screaming O: tuna with lots of spicy mayo, ponzu and daikon.. If you love super saucy things then get this.. Another rice less dish
-Carrot Top: shrimp tempura roll, with sauce and lots of fried shredded yams on top.. Presentation was nice and it tasted good too!
-Spider roll: wrapped in soy paper.. Crisp soft shell crap
-Bento Box: with teriyaki chicken and salmon = $18.95... No no no! It came with saddest looking "salad," the smallest pieces of chicken and salmon, store bought egg roll & potstickers, watery miso soup and a big bowl of rice.. This was a complete waste of money!

Service was friendly and fast.. Everyone was Korean so I'm assuming it's Korean owned? The bill came out to be what we would have paid at AYCE,.. I'm more of a nigiri person but I will say the rolls here are pretty good!


HOT TIP; they give you complimentary oranges for dessert!

If I could give this place 10 stars I would!!!! Sushi is fresh, large portions, price is fair and service is great. Spicy edimame great and I have not had a single roll here I didn't like. If I had the money I'd eat here everyday!!!!!!!
love this place for authentic traditional a la cart dish cant compare to all u can it places
Excellent.  By far the best sushi in northwest Las Vegas
Been a sushi eater since there was only one sushi restaurant in NYC. this place was amazing and so so different. It is worth the trip off the strip
Tried a few different rolls, liked them all. LOVED the egg rolls. First time here, will definitely come back.
It's the Best place for sushi,highly recommended really fresh and well made with lovely employees.the best sushi I have ever had.

Having been a professional poker player, I had heard great things about this from Texas Dolly Doyle Brunson and the likes of Daniel Negreanu.  Them and other poker players seem to have been great fans of this joint.

Lesson learned after eating there today?  Great poker players do not equate to foodies.

Nice staff, nice sushi chefs, but the food isn't great besides their fish tempura which was awesome-o.

With the surprisingly large number of good Japanese restaurants in the area you can definitely find better places than the Fever.  I will say, though, that most Japanese places in town have a large Asian clientele where this one is mostly Caucasian.  It's possible my many Caucasian friends will like this place better.  I could be used to different flavors, etc.

But they charged me like $7 for a unagi nagiri order.  2 pieces of mediocre unagi.  Really...it was dry.  Their rice is great but come on.  Unagi is supposed to be moist.

Should have known when their bento box comes with a California roll.  Yikes.  Their tonkatsu was dry and flavorless.  Again, maybe it's for Caucasian tastes as many of my friends distrust fattier parts of the pork.  But fat=flavor my friends.

My boyfriend and I heard about this place from a friend and had to try it. The edamame is cold which I don't prefer. We sat at the sushi bar for our first time. We always get Sapporo and sake to drink. Sake bombs are always fun. The sushi chef was funny and knowledgeable. He had great recommendations. I loved the chicken Katsu appetizer. We had three specialty rolls that were really great. We will definitely be back! This is the best sushi I've had in vegas so far.
A friend brought me here and I can say they have the best sushi in town. Tried "love me tender" roll and mmmm it melts in your mouth. I just love, love, love it!!!! Need to try all what they offer.

Talk about quality sushi. Whenever our friends and family are in town and they are craving for some sushi, this is the place we take them to. I mean WOW! Their flavor combination is simply irresistible! Their fish is sweet and fresh and makes you want to come back for some more. Our favorite on the menu, Carrot Top! They top these babies with fried strings of carrots - total party in your mouth. Our other favorite, Something Sexy #2, another one that has excellent flavor profile. Their staff is always friendly and we've never been disappointed. Some say they would prefer the AYCE sushi places and we get the cravings every once in a while but if you want quality sushi, this is the place to be!

I come here whenever I'm in Vegas. Consistently good and fresh. They have some great riceless rolls for those counting their carbs. We ordered the Oops and Burning Tail, both very good and the burning tail is spicy so only order if you can handle done serious heat. Service is good and quick.
Great Sushi!!!  Fresh fish and good menu. No rice sushi was winner. OPPA sushi guy is a awesome
The sushi is the best in town! The only reason I am giving 4 stars instead of 5 because only recently has the customer service improved. Just wish they had sticky rice like Sushi Kaya!

Holy WOW!
FAST AND FRIENDLY SERVICE
QUICK ORDER TO DELIVERY TURN-AROUND
FREAKING DELICIOUS SUSHI!!!!
And yes, those deserved all caps.
We ordered the Linda Special, Sexy #2, Johnny, and so many more. Our bill for 4 adults was $155 before tip and SO WORTH every dollar!!!
3 of the 4 adults were new to the place and each one said this was their new favorite sushi joint to go to!
WINNER!

I've been coming here for over ten years and it's always fresh and fabulous.  The Mel's roll and lasagna are the best.  Everything is really delicious and they don't flop on a bunch of rice.  The screaming o is one of my favorites as well as super spicy crab hand roll. It's packed typically so try to avoid the peak hours if you don't want to wait
One of my favorite sushi restaurants.  Always fresh fish with great culinary skills.  Staff is friendly and attentive.

Love that place. The menu is always the same., when I go there I always order my favorites I it's made exactly the same.
"Just for Halibut " Japanese lasagna " " Joe's special" OMG so good. I could eat this food everyday so fresh. I think I'm going to go for Sunday dinner again.

This is one of my favorite places to go in town. Reasons being -
(I am a roll type of girl, not sashimi. 

-They have awesome customer service. 
Each time we come here, we are greeted promptly with smiles and they seat us quickly. The guys at the bar are always super attentive and make sure you're getting everything you want. 
The place is very clean and nice looking. And the bathrooms are kept well, which is always a plus. 

-The prices are comparable to everywhere else. 

-They have some of the best rolls I've had in town. They have a good mix of rolls, but there is something about the sauces they use. We've had similar rolls at other places in town, and they just don't seem to compare. 

The best thing about this place is the "Grand Canyon" roll. Which is easily my favorite. It's a Cali roll topped with large pieces of shrimp, scallops, onions, mushrooms, chives and a delicious creamy sauce. Honestly, I could eat the topping without the roll itself.   

I also recommend - 

90% roll
Linda Special 
Baked Mussels
The BEST Sushi in town. awesome selection and terrific staff....one word "YUM"

Sushi Fever broke my cherry when it comes to Japanese cuisine and for that not many other restaurants can hold a candle to it. They're definitely in my top 5 places to eat sushi at, globally, in all aspects (service, quality, cleanliness, environment). I've made it a point to eat sushi, at least one restaurant, in every major city I've been to (Domestic and International) and nothing makes me feel closer to home or more satisfied than Sushi Fever.

Sushi fever is my favorite sushi restaurant in town! They never disappoint, there fish is always fresh! The "must haves" when I order are the Screaming Orgasm, Carrot Top, and the Ultimate Shrimp roll!! So amazing! Love this place!

Good sashimi and plenty of rolls with spice.  I've a big fan of rolls with heat and Sushi Fever has a solid selection that feature some sort of tuna/salmon combo.

Sat in the room to the left after you enter which featured a massive HD TV.  Comes in handy if you are like me and enjoy a distraction besides porcelain cats and other Japanese decor.

This place is awesome! Best sushi ever! The service is great. The chefs and the wait staff are so friendly and courteous. Sushi rolls are so creative and delicious. The fish is very fresh. My favorite is "sushi fever #3". I highly recommend this place. I go as often as I can. Love it!

How likely is it that the following thought would ever run through your head: "Man, I could be eating AYCE right now"? If your answer is moderately to highly likely, then you probably won't have the fever for this sushi joint. 

The attraction here is not AYCE; it is not an option. They don't have happy hour specials either. People come here for creative rolls made with ingredients other than spicy tuna, crab and fried shrimp. For example, several rolls include scallops. The rolls here average $12. You do receive complimentary edamame and cucumber salad, but don't expect any refills on those little treats! My husband was pleading with me to sweet talk us into some more edamame, but before I could even get up the courage, the waitress came and whisked away our bowl. No more edamame for us!
