The atmosphere might not be phenomenal, but I actually think the sushi bar is quite comfortable. Plus, the sushi chefs are particularly friendly and helpful. I could tell that our chef was concerned about our culinary experience. He was eager to find out what we liked so that he could make suggestions. Little did he know that when it comes to sushi, we're rather simplistic and not interested in the fancy stuff. Although, I did order a roll made with cucumber wraps in place of rice-- interesting, pretty tasty. Our other rolls appeared a little sloppy, but overall were fresh and flavorful.

Side note: I will forever be perplexed why restaurants use fake crab, especially when they are charging $12-$15/roll. Is that their way of telling you that you should not order crab?

My conclusion: If you are someone who really enjoys creative sushi rolls and doesn't mind paying a premium over AYCE, then you might appreciate Sushi Fever. However, if you think creativity is overrated, and you just want to stuff your hole with rolls, you should probably take a pass.

This place has been one of the best sushi restaurants in Vegas for years and years. Every time you come here the food will be top notch, it's consistently amazing. The sushi chefs are a blast, they yell hello when you come in and if you sit at the sushi bar they chat with you and are pretty funny- they're always drinking beers or sake even early in the afternoons haha! It does get crowded sometimes, but the wait is so worth it. My usuals are the:

Screaming orgasm 
Spicy edamame 
Rollie rice
Literally any sushi roll- they have amazing flavor combinations and sooooo many choices.

Service is seriously lacking... took 35 minutes at lunch to get a negi-toro roll and a philadelphia roll (and they weren't that busy!). Guests seated across from me who showed up 20 minutes after me were served first. UGH.

Service aside, the sushi is decent. Not great, but decent. It's definitely fresh, but the rolls were sloppy and big and didn't seem rolled up well. Prices were alright. I did find the lunch specials to be lacking. No sushi option (unless you count 4 pieces of a cali roll as "sushi") and not much variety. 

Sooo I love sushi has way better prices, fish, and rolls. However, I work near Sushi Fever instead of I love sushi. If I love sushi were anywhere nearby, I'd never go to this place again.

We go to this place  at least once a month great family atmosphere good service good food try to get there early normally after 5:30 6 o'clock would be  line outside on busy days try the ultimate shrimp also the screaming orgasms
Had dinner with my gf here the other day and sushi was on point as usual , discovered a new favorite roll called something sexy #1 i definetly recommend it as well as the tunaholic

Usually I try to start out my reviews (even the bad ones) with a positive, unfortunately I can't do that here. My family and I ate here for lunch today and now I remember why we haven't been back for 5 years. DIRTY, BAD SERVICE, & SLOPPY.

Upon walking in there was a terrible odor maybe the smell of old kimchi, but my family was starving and we decided to stay. We sat at the sushi bar and everyone said a miserable hello as though they were forced to say it. The staff just wasn't friendly at all. Felt like I was in a sauna, was too warm. The warm towels brought by the waitress smelled like they were sprayed with a horrible perfume. The upper counter top was covered in little black dots or old crumbs (lets hope). The sushi chef continually wiped his nose on top of his hands and was wiping sweat from his forehead. I have never seen a sushi bar so sloppy & disorganized, the fish looked old and mixed together on plates. The sushi chef was super quick making the rolls, but when the rolls came out they were pounded with Rice and were falling apart and loose. Hire people who actually care about there job and put love into the food. The ginger was dried out and seemed old. We had to ask for the check twice and it finally came over after 10 mins. My husband and I have been burping ever since we left, and I am praying we don't get sick. Everything about this place looked, smelt and tasted unsanitary. We will NEVER go back.

I love this place!! The staff is so great. I come there at least twice a week and they all remember me each time and are very friendly. The food comes out pretty quickly depending on how busy it is. I get either the tuna holic or the screaming o. Both great choices.

This place rocks!  I visit them every time I am in Vegas.  The service is great.  The sushi is out of this world.  The hamachi ngiri is like butter!  I've had a few of their special rolls and have not been disappointed.  Try a Sex #1 or a Monica or a Screaming Orgasm roll.  They serve you complimentary endamame, a small cucumber salad and a warm moist wash cloth.  Very nice touch!  I will be back and suggest you should visit!

The food is great but the service is super slow. We went when it opened at 11 and it took 35 minutes for us to get our food. This wont stop me from going back though. The Monica is delicious. If I ever end up on death row that will definitely be my last meal.
I crave the Nuclear roll on a weekly basis. This is not your average sushi. The sauces have just enough spice, but are still ok for a white girl like me. The fried mushrooms on top are my favorite!

Sushi Fever has been a staple in our city of Las Vegas for about 20 years. They are located on West Sahara between Buffalo and Cheyenne. If you are familiar with the menu then you know to order from the specials menu. It's funny because I bring people from all over the world and they start ordering all the basics only to find out that they don't want it after ordering and trying the chef specials which are amazing. The response that people have is always the same. They say I've never had anything like this before. They simply love it. So if you find time to try this place here are some of the favorites.
Something Sexy #2, Lamborghini Roll, Screaming O, Something Wrong #7, LiasLisa Roll, Grand Canyon, 90% Roll, and Don't Tell Mama just to name a few. Don't get me wrong the rest of the menu is fantastic as well, but the dishes above and a few others from the chef specials are what they're known for. Sushi Fever is always consistent and never disappoints you'll be glad you tried it. The staff is always on point and does their job by making sure everyone has a good experience while dining there. The only thing I would like them to change are the hours, they should stay open later. Midnight or 1AM would be great.

We have been coming here for years.   This was our go to spot for good Japanese food, close to home.  Within the last 6 months we finally decided to step outside of the box and try nEw sushi restaurant.  We found one that was satisfying the first visit, so we went back a couple times before returning to our trusty Sushi Fever. 
My hubby, kids and I came in for dinner on a week night last week.  There have been so many changes in the menu and unfortunately we don't like them.
First off, PORTION size has diminished quite a bit!  Prices didn't follow suit with less food being served.
Then they went and changed our favorite, the OMG roll.  It was terrible.   The snapper was so dry we left almost the whole roll to waste.
For those reasons I took off 2 stars from where I would've rated them before the changes.
Best Sushi in Vegas! Always consistent and excellent. Never had a bad meal, the fish is always fresh because they are always busy. Perfect locals spot.

Consistency. Fresh fish daily. Unique rolls and sauces. After 30 years of eating sushi, this place is my favorite. The sushi bar is very social. The staff works hard at identifying regulars and greeting you by name. I now have 'friends' there. The owners, the chefs, and the waitstaff all sincerely try to make your evening special. Great sushi, great people. No desire to explore options. This is simply the BEST!

I've been here twice and I definitely like it. The Don't Tell Mama roll is awesome! They don't do all you can eat sushi here, but their prices are pretty reasonable. The sushi chefs are very friendly and accommodating. I do have to say the chairs at the sushi bar are super uncomfortable! On my list visit, I felt it digging into my back the whole time, which made the experience less enjoyable. But other than that everything has been very good and I will probably return at some point.

Yumminess and great cost for your money.  Recommendation... Don't expect to get in and out... The service isn't the best. We sat down, party of 4 and out took forever to place our order... Then we had to inhale our food so we could get back to work on time (1 hour lunch)

This place has great sushi and fun creative rolls. I personally like the Japanese Lasagna, Screaming O, and the Tempura roll. The service is above par but they get packed pretty quickly at lunch, so we do alot of takeout since I work close by. I haven't tried any of the teppan dishes, but they also have teppan tables as well.
Great service.. Our waitress was really funny. Food is amazing and you have so many different types of sashimi, nigiri, rolls and hand rolls to choose from. I'll definitely be back.

This is my favorite restaurant on this great planet. I would like it to be my very last meal before I die! The Monica Roll and the Linda Special will leave your eyes shut and your buds (taste) in a euphoric state. A beautifully done establishment that I hope lives on for generations!

This really is great sushi.

I went here a few weeks back, and was impressed by the quality of the sushi.  Places like this can go either way in terms of food content, and I wanted to try a new place as I've been getting more rice than fish in my rolls.  

Not here.  We tried a few of the specialty rolls and a sashimi platter.  The rolls were tasty, but the platter really stood out.  They pack their rolls with fish, and everything tasted really fresh, so you definitely get what you pay for.  The prices themselves aren't that bad, either, so you can get filled up pretty quickly for a reasonable price.  Big points for their sake.  It helped to make the already pleasant rolls that much more, well, pleasant.

The service was no slouch, either.  Attentive to the point of covering whatever was needed, by not constantly in your face or disruptive when you had a mouth full of food.  Everything was very laid back and casual, and the servers were helpful for new choices.  Bear in mind this was during a lunch, so I can't speak for any potential dinner rush.

Overall, we enjoyed our experience here, and I would gladly go back to explore their other options.  At the very least, we now have yet another sushi place to frequent.

I could think of worse things to have.

I try new sushi place is in Las Vegas several times a month sometimes a couple times a week and I always keep going back to sushi fever and I always keep bringing out of town or's or locals the sushi fever this place is amazing I'm completely stage five clinger obsessed....see photos !!!!

While my husband and I were waiting for our food, we saw one of the waiters carrying a huge fish into the kitchen.  Husband says, "That means the fish is super fresh here, when they get the whole fish it's much better than frozen packs...."   Sure enough, the sushi was astoundingly good -- and we enjoyed large, thick slabs of fish  elegantly mounted on the rice.  We also got a Korean spicy chicken dish to go, which was wonderful, too. Plus, the waiter had no problem adjusting the dish to be cooked without sugar or flour.  He was super patient and nice.  Note: no brown rice, only white (if they offered brown rice I would have given this place a 5).

I love love love coming to this place. They have a fun busy sushi bar. Even though they are always busy the service is always prompt and attentive and the sushi is stellar. Try the crunch roll, so tasty.

Whenever I see lists of Vegas' best sushi restaurants, Sushi Fever never appears. This is preposterous and leads me to believe that the alleged foodies making such lists only get blood flowin down south when they get a free 15 course chef's special creation in chinatown or the strip. Because the truth is that I have never been to a sushi restaurant that can come anywhere close to matching the flavors developed at Sushi Fever. 

And here's the thing, if you consider yourself to be a sushi traditionalist, i.e. it's Jiro Dreams of Sushi style or bust, then sure Sushi Fever is not going to be your absolute favorite. It's highlights are not the sashimi, nigiri, etc. I think those items are very good and certainly the fish is fresh but Im sure that the rice isnt as meticulously crafted as it is in Japan, nor the wasabi, and their soy sauce is indeed kikkoman...gasp! But it's the speciality rolls with their layers and layers of ingredients that develop flavors I have yet to taste at any other sushi restaurant anywhere in the country.  Rolls like the TNT, Ultimate Shrimp, Joe's Special, and any of the sushi fever specials, are simply packed with flavor. A critical eater may say oh no there's too much sauce it makes the rolls a little soggy...point conceded and irrelevant. This place is about the flavor and on that front it delivers 100%.

I'm from California and consider myself a sushi snob but this place was the best!!!!

The nigiri salmon was melt in your mouth good.

The screaming O sashimi is served on a bed of shredded daikon and was A-MAZ-ING! spicy garlic tuna sashimi was also really good. 

If you want something different, try the apple roll.

This is the only sushi place that not only myself, but my family will eat as well. I recommend the Ultimate Shrimp roll as well as the Just for The Halibut! It's not an in and out place so plan on being here for a bit but it's great service and amazing food!

Sorry for the length but this review really hurts. My colleagues and I have been going to Sushi Fever for many years (since 2003) whenever we are in Vegas for business. We have always found both the food and service to be exceptional and the prices extremely reasonable. In addition we always recognized most of the chefs and servers and felt very comfortable and welcomed. 
    Earlier this month we (4 of us) visited on a Tuesday (6/5) around 9:30PM to find an almost empty room. At the time we felt lucky about the crowd and looked forward to our usual exceptional meal and service. Unfortunately the service was extremely slow and unfriendly plus the rice seemed to be falling apart upon removing any Nigiri from the plates. During dinner we received a call from friends wanting to meet us there. After being told last call was at 10:45, our server began pressuring us to order for them at 10:30. In the end we all felt the food was okay (not great) and the service was nowhere near our previous 30+ trips.
   On Thursday (6/7) several of our trade show colleagues wanted to go eat at Fever and asked us to come along. With 10 in-tow on a Thursday night we were hopeful for a redemption meal. Well...that did NOT happen. Service was EXTREMELY slow and considering the fact we had several novices to the menu, the server was of no help and couldn't answer basic questions about the rolls. I ordered for all and the food was a disappointment compared to previous visits.
   Fortunately, I live about 10 miles from sushi fever in Texas where the son of the original owner resides and makes what I considered to be some of the best sushi I have eaten. As for the Vegas Sushi Fever, we can only hope it was an off week.
Fantastic sushi! New place for us but it will become a regular. Service was great and never rushed us out when we sat and chatted for an hour after finishing.

i come here all the time with my friends. 
this is their favorite japanese restaurant, but most of them don't like to eat raw food. [do you see the flaw in this]

i would never choose to eat here, but i will just to hang out with my friends. 
i think it's pretty pricey. 

if you do choose to eat here:
screaming O and the james bond roll are a must!

you can sit at the sushi bar, table or the teppan counter

Sushi Fever certainly makes a strong, strong case for the "Most Interesting Meal of My Life".

I suppose that I should have entered my dinner with this expectation in mind, as I was already coming fresh off of the sensory stimulation-packed slambanggasms of the 2011 Electric Daisy Carnival. With this being said, my dining companions and I were looking forward to a relaxing, refreshing meal - the ideal contrast to three days' worth of dancing between the hours of 8 PM and 6 AM. 

In a way, Sushi Fever certainly did accomplish just that. The sheer variety of the restaurant's offerings is simply staggering, as the five separate types of menus awaiting our party of six were accompanied by lists of the day's specials that were craftily placed under the glass surface of our table. Although it did take some time to decide between dozens of sushi varieties (and a nifty selection of entree items such as teriyaki, as well), I decided on a Crunch Roll (a reliable classic that has yet to disappoint me at any sushi bar) and a Honey Roll (I think that was what it was called, I know that it was the first item on one of the special rolls menus and that the roll was listed as being drizzled with eel sauce). 

My fellow diners and I also ordered two orders of gyoza - one steamed and one fried. Each order consisted of six potstickers, so all six of us exhausted rave-slaves were able to sample the dual dishes' tender/crispy textures and refreshing meat/broth filling. The dishes also came with a nice bowl of edamame - just what my tired bones and seratonin-depleted brain were looking for! Healthy and refreshing.

NOTE: THIS ENDS THE PORTION OF THE REVIEW WHERE THE DINING EXPERIENCE CAN BE CONSIDERED "NORMAL". Thank you.

Upon finishing our appetizers, my friends and I expected to receive our entrees within roughly 5-10 minutes. Strangely enough, Sushi Fever seemed grounded in the practice of bringing our entrees out one by one. Poor Nick got his chicken teriyaki almost twenty minutes before any other entrees were served, and it must've been strange for him to nibble on the twin chicken breasts bit-by-bit as the rest of us suppressed our appetites. I sampled a bit of the miso salad that his teriyaki came with (the dish also comes with miso soup), and the salad was relatively tasty, but not anything to write home about. 

Ryan was the next at our table to receive his dinner, and he too attempted to slow down his eating while waiting for the rest of our entrees to be served. The gap between the arrival of his entree and the arrival of the next two dishes was about ten minutes, and I did note that the restaurant appeared to be picking up in pace rapidly, as dinner customers were arriving in larger parties. Still, shouldn't establishments be prepared for stuff like this?

Nevertheless, my food finally arrived. The Crunch Roll had a somewhat strange presentation; it almost seemed as though the roll had been organized in a sort of jumbled fashion on the plate, and the sushi was positioned in a shallow plate of sweet sauce (not quite teriyaki sweet, but still sweet nonetheless). 

Now inevitably, you're probably wondering how Sushi Fever earned three stars (or any stars at all), and this rating is due almost entirely to the INSANE FLAVOR OF THE SOOSH! For all of the restaurant's shortcomings, I cannot deny that my sixteen dollars certainly went far in the way of the food itself; funky presentation and Snorlax-esque service couldn't upset the fact that the Crunch Roll had an unforgettable contrast of texture and that the Honey Roll offered a mellow, rich, refreshing flavor that jolted the tastebuds in the same way that the Swedish House Mafia's drops jolted my eyes into the back of my head at around 1 AM on Sunday morning. Pure bliss. The portion size on the Honey Roll did leave a bit to be desired, however.

Our meal took a turn for Beyond Wonderland, however, once my friend Scott received his "Chef's Special". I'm not entirely sure as to what the roll's contents were, but the dish resembled a regular sushi roll with a transplanted hat of crabmeat glued to the top. Looks weren't deceiving on this day, as Scott took a bite of his sushi and promptly proceeded to gag, again and again (HAHAHA). He washed the piece of sushi down with some lemonade, and my friends and I decided to have a Man Vs. Food moment of our own by sampling the choke-inducing dish.

Oh my.

Strange stuff; I suppose that being Filipino really saved me today, as my companions each began to put on the most grotesque faces upon sampling the Chef's Special. My tongue, specifically, was greeted by relatively normal sushi flavors and an undesirable gut-punch of bitterness (not the sharp heat of wasabi, nor the unmistakable flavor of ginger, mind you, but some awful bitterness). Never again. 

In any case, Sushi Fever was a hit-or-miss experience. Kinda like Russian Roulette. You just gotta know what to order.

Sushi Fever is my favorite sushi place. It is located right off West Sahara in between Buffalo Dr. and Cimarron Rd. I have been dining here for about ten years. I know that the sushi is consistent in taste and I enjoy the casual atmosphere. We always sit at the sushi bar, where it is easy to strike about a conversation with strangers. I always like to see what others order and hear their opinions which spurs me on to try something new. When we are in larger parties, we will sit at a table but not the same. We enjoy interacting with the sushi chefs and we often will treat them to a beer or sake (Kumpai!) Often, they will give us a new roll to try so it makes it worth it to be friendly.  The dinner begins with a cup of edamame, followed by the traditional cucumber and crab salad. The sushi chef provides you with your tray of pickled ginger and wasabi. We always start with the traditional rainbow roll which gives you a taste of salmon, ahi tuna, shrimp, yellowtail. I am a strong believer in avocado in my rolls as well. Just love the creaminess it provides in the rolls. Next we move on to the extraordinary Apple Roll served with a side of Ponzu sauce. The unbelievable thing about this roll is how much the apple that is wrapped around this roll sets off the taste of this fish. I could eat these all day long....seriously! We finished off with Rock and Roll which consists of tuna, crab, whitefish wrapped in  cucumber. This roll is served with a side of ponzu sauce mixed with a little creamy mayo. The fish always taste fresh and  I love the fact that whenever I eat sushi, I walk away satisfied instead of full. We close the meal out with oranges which is a nice topper instead of a heavy dessert offering. The service is spot on and friendly. 

I enjoy trying other sushi restaurants but Sushi Fever is hands down the place I eat sushi at most often. If you are in the neighborhood, be sure to give them a try

My favorite sushi spot! Service is always fast, the Monica roll and spicy garlic edamame is a must have!! Definitely never disappointed! I like to get my sushi thin sliced because some of them are too big and they never have a problem with doing that unlike other sushi places.
This is my favorite sushi place!  Lots of options for those with different sushi experience and great service every time.
Wow what can you say, an amazing experience and sushi. You must have the Carrot Top roll that is amazing and beautiful. Would have a picture if I hadn't eaten so fast.
Great service, even when busy, the staff was very attentive.  Try the sashimi appetizer salad! It was generous and they certainly didn't get skimpy with the tuna and salmon...a must have!

This place has great sushi and great rolls.  Daily specials of fresh delivered delicious fishes.  The selection and variety of rolls are huge, service is fast and friendly and the the atmosphere at the sushi bar rocks.  Place gets crowded and loud so it's no place for a business meeting but if you like sushi and Japanese food you can't find a better place.  No all you can eat deal but prices are reasonable.  They will shuffle you in hungry and shuffle you out full.

Absolutely the best sushi place in Vegas!!!  Huge selection of variety of rolls and they will prepare special rolls no problem.  This is one of my favorite lunch places and always take guests whenever possible.  Mid range prices, but large size rolls and friendly service easily make up for that.
Sooooo good!! I highly recommend garlic edamame and the Monica roll.  can't go wrong.
Barely saw my waiter and the food was ok! Not the worst but just wish they could've had a little better service and a little better food!

Came hungry and left not... #winning... On a serious note... The udon is very bland in my humble opinion... Don't order it! Fine do it... But you been warned... Their sushi is pretty descent... I mean I wish they had an all you can eat sushi option but I can't be too harsh on that. Ok fine, you won't give us an all you can eat option... At least tease us with a happy hour... Staff was friendly and happy.

This sushi was terrible. The fish wasn't fresh, the nigiri was huge globs of thick rice. They stuff all their sushi with over cooked, dry, and bad tasting shrimp tempura. The service was pretty bad to top it off. I hated the whole experience. Yuck

I went for diner last night, sat at the Sushi Bar and Ahun helped me.  He was great.  The menu is loaded with all kinds of good looking rolls, but I was interested in more traditional style sushi.  Ahun gave me some amazingly fresh salmon, tuna, bluefin tuna, and then he even told me to try toe japanese mackeral which was great! He could tell that I was a sushi lover and offered me fresh/real wasabi which was amazing too.  I also had a few hand rolls and a very tasty mango salmon roll (no rice) that Ahun told me he created on the menu.

I come to Vegas every week and have not yet found any great sushi places, even in the expensive resorts the sushi is just blah.  Overall this not fancy, off the strip local sushi place is one of the best on Vegas, for whatever that is worth.  In L.A. or OC maybe this would be 3-4 stars, but in Vegas its a 5.
Sushi Fever is excellent. The fish is extremely tender and the sushi roll options are very creative. We love the apple roll!

Yep a 5 star experience. The fresh of the freshest. We walked in sat at counter talked to owner he told waitress he would take care of us and the food just kept coming. It was his choice with a few suggestions from us. So freaking good.

This is my absolute favorite sushi restaurant in all of Vegas!!! The combination of rolls are incredible , the service is always friendly...You must order the 99 roll its not on the menu but is by far their best roll. Sushi fever a little bit pricey but is well well worth it for great sushi .....

Growing up in Hawaii We never had a lack of fresh fish. Now that I live in Cincinnati, I wish i would of eaten what was more readily available as a kid. Once my folks moved to Vegas, they knew what i was saying all these years. Once you leave the ocean, you leave delicious fresh fish. The more land locked you are, the more it all taste like LJS, yuck :(

So while visiting my folks, mom wanted to go out for some Sashimi Ahi. Almost laughing on the inside we searched yelp to find something worth trying, and Thank the heavens above we decided on this place.

Its located in a business park almost, but as we drove by, Sushi fever was jam packed with cars parked in front of it, good sign number one.

As we entered the place was busy and hopping, but we got to sit at the Sushi bar, the best place to sit in my opinion and was given a bowl of edamame from out Sushi Chef, excellent sign number 2.

As Dad and I went on the hunt for what rolls we wanted, Mom just blurted out 3 Sashimi Ahi to get the party started. WOW this was some of the best fish i have had since leaving Hawaii. The Ahi was perfect in color, the flavor was super fantastic, and the texture was spot on. No gritty over frozen or pale flesh to look it. 

This is a place to go!
Great sushi, but always so busy. Staff is ok. Sushi bar is crowded during rush hour.

Recently visited here, was horrible experience ever! One of waitress working there was extremely rude and miserable to be there! She was really disrespectful! I feel so uncomfortable. Her Service was totally the worst one that I could never imagine.
Sushi is excellent, service spotty at times.  Staff is friendly and accommodating to allergy request.  Recommenced!

The only thing that needs to be said about this place is that it is the BEST sushi place in Las Vegas! I've tried almost every sushi place in town. Nothing even comes close to Sushi Fever. Every roll they have is just amazing.
Recently, every time I've been the service has been awful! They forget what you order don't approach you at all unless you yell for assistance & most of the servers have terrible attitudes.

My Wife & I have been coming to Sushi Fever for years now & they never disappoint. Very fresh product, attentive staff and creative dishes always makes for a memorable experience. I would highly recommend this place event to the pickiest of sushi lovers.
This is by far my favorite spot for sushi. Unique selection, clean and friendly staff

So normally I would have rated this place 5 stars. My family and I have been coming to Sushi Fever for over 10 yrs. This was always our favorite place but today...ugh.. it was packed as usual tonight and my bf and I sat at the sushi bar. We ordered the Monica roll and kalbi. They brought us our Kalbi and told us they take out of rice, so we ended up waiting 20mins for them to cook it. Finally, they brought it to the table and halfway through, I saw a long piece of hair. I immediately stopped eating and asked for he check. I let the waitress know and when she looked, she asked me if it was my hair- seriously?? That piece of hair was cooked into the kalbi, IT WASN'T MINE....she seemed annoyed and then asked if I wanted it off the bill, mind you we still had half of the kalbi untouched. They ended up taking it off however they were noticeably irritated. 

Sad to say, I won't be going back. Looks like I'll switch to naked fish. It's a shame because most of the staff is friendly but tonight was awful. Sushi fever, please make your staff wear hairnets!

This place was great 3 years ago, overtime they are going downhill. Today I got Jackpot special and it was not even close to that jackpot special that I had 6 month ago. 
Will not come back.
